"recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cut the tilapia into \"fingers\" by first cutting the fillets in half. Leave the thin sides long, then cut the thicker sides in half on a diagonal so they appear longer.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pan-fried-fish-fingers.html#fv-recipe-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Set up three large shallow bowls in an assembly line. Put the flour in the first bowl; the beaten eggs in the second; and the panko in the third.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pan-fried-fish-fingers.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil. Dredge the fish fingers in the flour mixture, shaking excess into the bowl so just a light coating remains; dip in the eggs and turn to coat evenly; then dredge in the panko, turning several times to coat evenly.  (This can be a messy job...it's best to use one hand for the flour and eggs and the other for the panko.) Set the breaded tilapia fingers on the prepared baking sheet and season with salt and pepper. Cover and refrigerate until ready to cook (this can be done several hours ahead of time).", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pan-fried-fish-fingers.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Line a plate with 3 paper towels and set by the stove. Coat a large non-stick saut\u00e9 pan generously with olive oil and place over medium heat. When the pan is hot, place the first batch of tilapia fingers in the pan (do not crowd) and cook until the first side is golden brown, 2 to 3 minutes. Flip and continue cooking until done, about 2 minutes more. Transfer the fish fingers to the plate with paper towels and let sit for a minute to drain any excess oil. Remove any brown bits out of the pan, add more oil if necessary and continue to cook the fish in batches until done. Season the cooked tilapia fingers with more salt if desired. Serve with lemon wedges and Lemon-Garlic Mayonnaise.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pan-fried-fish-fingers.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Mix the mayonnaise, garlic and lemon juice in a small bowl. Add salt and pepper to taste.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pan-fried-fish-fingers.html#fv-recipe-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "<strong>Freezer-Friendly Instructions:</strong> You can freeze the fish sticks both before and after frying for convenience. To freeze before frying, bread the fish sticks according to the recipe, lay them out on a parchment-lined baking sheet to freeze solid, then transfer to a freezer-safe bag or container and store for up to 3 months; allow them to thaw slightly so they'll lay flat in the pan, then fry them according to the instructions. If you prefer to freeze them after frying, let the fish sticks cool completely, then freeze them on a baking sheet before transferring to a freezer bag. Reheat frozen, pre-fried fish sticks in an oven preheated to 350\u00b0F until they are hot and crispy.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pan-fried-fish-fingers.html#fv-recipe-step-6"}], "recipeIngredient": ["2 pounds tilapia fillets (cod or haddock may be substituted)", "1 cup all-purpose flour", "3  eggs, beaten", "2 cups panko", " Salt", " Ground black pepper", " Olive oil", "1 lemon, cut into wedges", "1 cup mayonnaise, best quality such as Hellmann's or Duke's", "1  clove garlic, minced", "2 tablespoons freshly squeezed lemon juice, from 1 lemon", " Salt and ground black pepper, to taste"], "recipeYield": "4 to 6", "image": ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2024/03/Crispy-Tilapia-Fingers-Hero-5.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2024/03/Crispy-Tilapia-Fingers-Hero-5-500x500.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2024/03/Crispy-Tilapia-Fingers-Hero-5-500x375.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2024/03/Crispy-Tilapia-Fingers-Hero-5-480x270.jpg"], "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": 4.95, "ratingCount": "58"}, "datePublished": "2024-03-29T15:16:27-04:00", "keywords": "All Seasons, Panko, Tilapia", "recipeCuisine": "American", "recipeCategory": "Recipes"}]

If you'd like the cookies to look extra chocolatey and tempting after baking, press a few additional chocolate chips gently onto the top of each dough ball. Bake for 13 to 15 minutes, until golden around the edges but still soft and pale in the center. Let cool for a few minutes on the baking sheet, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely. Repeat with the remaining cookie dough, refrigerating the dough between batches. The cookies will keep in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 3 days.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/gluten-free-chocolate-chip-cookies.html#fv-recipe-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Freezer-Friendly Instructions: The cookie dough can be frozen for up to 3 months. To freeze, roll the dough into balls, let set on a baking sheet in the freezer for about 1 hour, then place in a sealable bag and press out as much air as possible. Bake as needed directly from the freezer. (Allow 1 to 2 minutes longer in the oven.) The baked cookies can also be frozen for up to 3 months. Let the cookies cool completely and store in an airtight container separating layers with parchment paper or aluminum foil. Before serving, remove the cookies from the container and let them come to room temperature.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/gluten-free-chocolate-chip-cookies.html#fv-recipe-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Note: When shopping for gluten-free flour, you'll typically find two primary options: \"gluten-free all-purpose flour\" and \"gluten-free measure-for-measure flour.\" For this recipe, opt for the measure-for-measure variety (I use King Arthur), as it's a one-to-one substitute for regular flour, including necessary binders that improve the texture of baked goods.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/gluten-free-chocolate-chip-cookies.html#fv-recipe-step-8"}], "recipeIngredient": ["2\u00be cups gluten-free measure-for-measure flour, spooned into measuring cup and leveled off (see note)", "1\u00bd teaspoons  baking powder", "1 teaspoon  baking soda", "1 teaspoon  salt", "2 sticks (1 cup)  unsalted butter, at room temperature", "\u00be cup  granulated sugar", "\u00be cup  (packed) light or dark brown sugar", "2 teaspoons  vanilla extract", "2  large eggs", "2 tablespoons  water", "1\u2153 cups (9 oz)  semi-sweet chocolate chips, with additional chips set aside for dotting on top of the dough balls just before baking"], "recipeYield": "40 cookies", "image": ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2024/11/gluten-free-chocolate-chip-cookies.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2024/11/gluten-free-chocolate-chip-cookies-500x500.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2024/11/gluten-free-chocolate-chip-cookies-500x375.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2024/11/gluten-free-chocolate-chip-cookies-480x270.jpg"], "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": 5, "ratingCount": "2"}, "datePublished": "2024-11-28T05:47:34-05:00", "keywords": "", "recipeCuisine": "American", "recipeCategory": "Recipes"}]

"position": 1, "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chicken-enchiladas-with-tomatillo-sauce.html#faq-question-1707393790099", "name": "How can I make the enchiladas less spicy?", "answerCount": 1, "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "To reduce the spiciness of the enchiladas, there are several adjustments you can make. First, when preparing the tomatillo sauce, remove the seeds and veins from the jalape\u00f1o chiles, as this is where most of the heat resides. If you're particularly sensitive to spice, you can reduce the number of jalape\u00f1os used in the recipe or substitute them with a milder green chile, such as poblanos. Additionally, the cooling effects of dairy can help balance spiciness, so serving your enchiladas with a dollop of sour cream can make them more palatable if you're looking to tone down the heat.", "inLanguage": "en-US"}, "inLanguage": "en-US"}, {"@type": "Question", "@id": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chicken-enchiladas-with-tomatillo-sauce.html#faq-question-1707399689024", "position": 2, "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chicken-enchiladas-with-tomatillo-sauce.html#faq-question-1707399689024", "name": "Can I make chicken enchiladas ahead of time?", "answerCount": 1, "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "Yes, the enchiladas can be assembled up to one day ahead of time, tightly covered with foil, and refrigerated until ready to bake. Allow a few extra minutes in the oven if baking from cold. ", "inLanguage": "en-US"}, "inLanguage": "en-US"}, {"@type": "Question", "@id": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chicken-enchiladas-with-tomatillo-sauce.html#faq-question-1707399745336", "position": 3, "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chicken-enchiladas-with-tomatillo-sauce.html#faq-question-1707399745336", "name": "Can chicken enchiladas be frozen?", "answerCount": 1, "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "Yes, the enchiladas can be frozen after baking for up to 3 months. When ready to serve, defrost them in the refrigerator overnight and then reheat, covered in foil, in a 325\u00b0F (165\u00b0C) oven until hot.", "inLanguage": "en-US"}, "inLanguage": "en-US"}, {"@type": "Recipe", "name": "Chicken Enchiladas with Tomatillo Sauce", "author": {"@id": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/#/schema/person/d09ca52c9e790675f71c46404845af62"}, "description": "Brimming cloves garlic, (roughly chopped)", "\u00be lb tomatillos, (husks and stems removed, cut into 1-in  chunks)", "3  jalape\u00f1o peppers, (seeded and roughly chopped)", "1 teaspoon sugar", "\u00be teaspoon salt", "\u00bc teaspoon ground cumin", "1 lb chicken tenderloins", "2 teaspoons ground cumin", "1\u00bd teaspoons smoked paprika", "1 teaspoon salt", "2 tablespoons olive oil", "1  medium yellow onion, (chopped)", "\u00bd cup chopped fresh cilantro leaves", "8 oz (2 cups) shredded sharp cheddar cheese", "10 to 12  (6-in) corn tortillas", "2\u00bd tablespoons olive oil", "3 oz (\u00be cup) shredded sharp cheddar cheese", "Smoked paprika", "Cilantro leaves, (sour cream, shredded lettuce, avocado, lime wedges)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToSection", "name": "For the Tomatillo Sauce", "itemListElement": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Heat the oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add the onions and garlic and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened, about 5 minutes. Add the tomatillos, jalape\u00f1os, sugar, salt, cumin and \u2153 cup (80 ml) water; bring to a simmer, then reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer until tomatillos are softened, about 8 minutes. Transfer the mixture to a blender and pur\u00e9e until completely smooth. Set aside.", "name": "Heat the oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add the onions and garlic and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened, about 5 minutes. It can be stored in the fridge for up to 3 days. Reheat on the stovetop over medium-low heat until hot. If you want to freeze the stew, transfer it to an airtight container once it has cooled. It can be frozen for up to 3 months. To serve, thaw the stew overnight in the refrigerator and reheat on the stovetop.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/guinness-lamb-stew-with-vegetables.html#fv-recipe-step-8"}], "recipeIngredient": ["3 pounds lamb shoulder, well-trimmed and cut into 1\u00bd-inch pieces", "2 teaspoons salt", "1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper", "3 tablespoons vegetable or olive oil", "2 medium yellow onions, cut into 1\u00bd-inch", "6 cloves garlic, peeled and smashed", "3 tablespoons tomato paste", "\u00bc cup all-purpose flour ", "1 cup Guinness", "3 cups beef broth", "2 cups water, plus 2 tablespoons more for cooking onions and garlic", "1 bay leaf", "1 small sprig fresh rosemary", "2 teaspoons sugar", "4  large carrots, peeled and cut into 1-inch chunks on diagonal", "1 pound small white boiling potatoes (baby yukons), cut in half", "1 cup frozen green peas"], "recipeYield": "4 to 6", "image": ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2024/03/lamb-stew-4-1200x1600.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2024/03/lamb-stew-4-500x500.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2024/03/lamb-stew-4-500x375.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2024/03/lamb-stew-4-480x270.jpg"], "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": 4.75, "ratingCount": "107"}, "datePublished": "2024-03-08T10:27:31-05:00", "keywords": "Beer, Carrots, Comfort Food, Fall, Lamb Shoulder, Peas, Potatoes, St. Patricks Day, Stew, Tomatoes, Winter", "recipeCuisine": "Irish", "recipeCategory": "Recipes"}]

", "prepTime": "PT35M", "cookTime": "PT55M", "totalTime": "PT1H30M", "nutrition": {"@type": "NutritionInformation", "servingSize": "2 manicotti", "calories": "735", "fatContent": "46 g", "carbohydrateContent": "40 g", "proteinContent": "40 g", "saturatedFatContent": "28 g", "unsaturatedFatContent": "", "sugarContent": "8 g", "fiberContent": "4 g", "sodiumContent": "1,413 mg", "cholesterolContent": "213 mg"}, "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 350\u00b0F and set an oven rack in the middle position.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/spinach-manicotti.html#fv-recipe-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "<strong>Parboil the Manicotti Shells:</strong> Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook the manicotti shells for exactly 6 minutes (they will only be partially cooked). Drain well and rinse with cold water.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/spinach-manicotti.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "<strong>Make the Filling:</strong> In a large bowl, beat the eggs. Add the ricotta, mascarpone cheese (or cream cheese), 1 cup of the mozzarella, 1 cup of the Pecorino Romano, the spinach, basil, garlic, oregano, and salt; mix until evenly combined. Transfer the filling to a pastry bag or large zip-lock bag. (If using a zip-lock bag, be sure the corners are square; the rounded-corner bags are difficult to use.) Twist and squeeze the bag so the filling is in one corner. With scissors, snip a \u00be-inch opening in corner. Pipe the filling into both ends of the manicotti shells, filling until completely full. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/spinach-manicotti.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "<strong>Make the Sauce:</strong> In a large bowl, stir together the marinara sauce and heavy cream.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/spinach-manicotti.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "<strong>Assemble and Bake:</strong> Spread \u00be cup of the sauce into a 9x13-inch baking dish. Arrange the stuffed manicotti shells, narrow side up, over the sauce. Pour just enough sauce to cover the manicotti (you'll have about \u00be cup leftover; save it for serving). Cover the dish tightly with aluminum foil. Bake for 35 minutes. Uncover and top the manicotti with the remaining 1 cup mozzarella and \u00bc cup Pecorino Romano cheeses Bake, uncovered, for 10 to 15 minutes more, until the cheese is melted and lightly golden. (To brown the cheese further, turn on the broiler and bake for a few more minutes, keeping a close eye, until the cheese is golden.) Let sit for about 10 minutes before serving. Warm the reserved sauce and pass at the table for anyone who would like extra.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/spinach-manicotti.html#fv-recipe-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Make-Ahead/Freezer-Friendly Instructions: The dish can be assembled, covered, and refrigerated for up to 2 days in advance, or frozen for up to 3 months. (If frozen, defrost in the refrigerator overnight before baking.) Dredge the chicken in the flour, coating evenly; dip in the eggs, letting any excess drip off; then dredge in the panko mixture, turning and patting to adhere. Place the breaded chicken on the prepared baking sheet. (The recipe can be prepared up to this point, covered, and refrigerated up to 8 hours ahead of time.) ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/easy-chicken-parmesan.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the broiler and set an oven rack about 4 inches from the heating element. Cover and keep warm.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/easy-chicken-parmesan.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Line another baking sheet with aluminum foil or parchment for easy clean up; set aside. In a large nonstick skillet, heat about \u215b inch of oil over medium heat until shimmering. Place 5 or 6 tenders in the pan in a single layer and cook until the first side is golden brown, 2 to 3 minutes. Flip the chicken and cook for another 2 to 3 minutes, until golden and cooked through. Place the cooked chicken on the prepared baking sheet. Cook the remaining chicken in the same manner, adding additional oil only if necessary. You may need to lower the the heat as you go, so that the chicken doesn't brown before it is cooked through. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/easy-chicken-parmesan.html#fv-recipe-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Sprinkle the fontina and remaining 2 tablespoons Parmigiano Reggiano over the center of the chicken tenderloins, leaving the sides bare so that they remain crispy. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/strawberry-shortcake.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Put one-third of the berries in a medium bowl and, using a potato masher or a fork, mash them into a chunky pur\u00e9e. Top with a generous dollop of whipped cream and cover each with a biscuit top. Spoon more berries and cream over each shortcake and serve immediately.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/strawberry-shortcake.html#fv-recipe-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Note: If you\u2019d like to make your own buttermilk, check out the easy method <a href=\"https://www.onceuponachef.com/how-to/how-to-make-buttermilk.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</a>.teaspoons of lemon juice or white vinegar to a liquid measuring cup. They can also be frozen for up to 3 months. To freeze: place the unbaked biscuits on a baking sheet, cover with plastic wrap, and freeze until solid. Remove the firm biscuits from the freezer, place in an airtight bag, and store in the freezer. Bake the biscuits directly from the freezer, allowing a few extra minutes baking time. \r\n\r\nThe whipped cream can be made a few hours before serving but err on the side of under-beating. Store it covered in the refrigerator and give it a final whip by hand to get it to a pillowy consistency just before serving.\r\n\r\nThe strawberries cannot be made ahead.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/strawberry-shortcake.html#fv-recipe-step-9"}], "recipeIngredient": [" ", "2 cups all-purpose flour, spooned into measuring cup and leveled-off ", "3 tablespoons cornstarch", "1 tablespoon baking powder", "\u00bc teaspoon baking soda", "2 tablespoons granulated sugar", "1 teaspoon salt", "10 tablespoons cold unsalted butter, cut into \u00bd-inch chunks", "\u00be cup buttermilk (see note)", "2 tablespoons turbinado sugar", "2 pounds strawberries, hulled and sliced \u00bc-inch thick", "3 tablespoons seedless raspberry jam", "\u00bd cup granulated sugar", "1\u00bd cups heavy cream", "3 tablespoons granulated sugar"], "recipeYield": "8", "image": ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2018/07/Strawberry-Shortcake-1200x1500.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2018/07/Strawberry-Shortcake-500x500.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2018/07/Strawberry-Shortcake-500x375.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2018/07/Strawberry-Shortcake-480x270.jpg"], "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": 4.98, "ratingCount": "129"}, "datePublished": "2023-05-13T09:24:44-04:00", "keywords": "Buttermilk, Comfort Food, Easter, Jam, July 4th, Mother's Day, Spring, Strawberries, Summer", "recipeCuisine": "American", "recipeCategory": "Recipes"}]

Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/spiced-nuts.html#fv-recipe-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large bowl, mix the sugar, salt, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg, cayenne pepper (if using), water, and corn syrup. Add the nuts and toss with spice mixture until evenly coated. Transfer the nuts to the prepared baking sheet and arrange in a single layer, making sure the syrupy spice mixture is evenly distributed. Bake for 35 to 45 minutes, stirring once halfway through, until the nuts are caramelized and lightly toasted. (To check for doneness, take a few nuts out of the oven and set them on a cool surface for a few minutes; if done, they will be dry to the touch.) Carefully slide or lift the parchment and nuts off of the hot baking sheet and onto a countertop; let cool completely. Break up the nuts with your hands. Store in an airtight container in a cool, dark place for up to one week.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/spiced-nuts.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}], "recipeIngredient": ["\u00bc cup (packed) dark brown sugar", "1 scant teaspoon salt", "1 teaspoon  ground cinnamon", "\u00be teaspoon  ground ginger", "\u00bc teaspoon  ground nutmeg", "\u00bc teaspoon  cayenne pepper (optional)", "2 tablespoons  water", "1 tablespoon  light corn syrup", "3\u00bd cups  raw unsalted nuts (I use equal parts cashews and pecans, but you can use any combination of cashews, pecans, and almonds)"], "recipeYield": "3\u00bd cups", "image": ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2022/12/spiced-nuts-1200x1717.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2022/12/spiced-nuts-500x500.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2022/12/spiced-nuts-500x375.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2022/12/spiced-nuts-480x270.jpg"], "citation": "Adapted from <a href=\"https://amzn.to/3uNbWKr\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener sponsored\">Mix Shake Stir</a> by Danny Meyer", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": 4.22, "ratingCount": "9"}, "datePublished": "2022-12-14T11:10:40-05:00", "keywords": "", "recipeCuisine": "", "recipeCategory": "Recipes"}]

Microwave on high power until boiling, about 1 minute. Add the chopped chocolate. (Alternatively, place the chocolate in a medium bowl. In a small saucepan, bring the cream and corn syrup to a boil and then pour it over the chocolate.) Let the mixture sit for 30 seconds, then whisk until smooth and glossy. Let the ganache cool until slightly thickened but still pourable, whisking occasionally so a film doesn't form on top, 10 to 15 minutes. (If it gets too thick, you can warm it in the microwave for 10 seconds, or until just pourable.)  ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/german-chocolate-cake.html#fv-recipe-step-10"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "For a 3 layer cake: Place 1 cake layer, rounded side down, on a cake platter. Using a metal spatula, spread \u2153 of the coconut-pecan frosting over the layer. Add the second layer, rounded side down; spread with \u2153 of the frosting. Add the third layer, rounded side up; spread with remaining frosting, leaving the sides of the cake unfrosted. For a 2-layer cake, follow the same procedure but spread half of the frosting over the bottom layer and the remaining half over the top layer. Prepare the chocolate glaze and drizzle it over the top of the cake, letting it drip down the sides. The cake layers can also be frozen without the frosting for up to 3 months. Let them cool completely, wrap them individually in plastic wrap, and then in foil. Add the shallots and cook, stirring frequently, until soft and translucent, about 4 minutes. Add the garlic and cook, stirring constantly, for 1 minute more. Do not brown. Add the heavy cream, salt, pepper, and nutmeg and bring to a gentle boil. Cook, uncovered, stirring occasionally, until the cream is thick enough to coat a wooden spoon, about 10 minutes. Add the cheese and stir until melted. Add the spinach and stir until evenly combined with the cream sauce. Taste and adjust seasoning if necessary. (If the spinach seems a little watery, cook over medium-low heat until any excess liquid evaporates.) Serve warm.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/creamed-spinach.html#fv-recipe-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Note: Cut leaf spinach is not the same as chopped spinach. If your market doesn't carry cut leaf spinach, look for frozen whole leaf spinach. (Chopped spinach will work but the texture won't be as appealing.) Some markets carry 1-lb bags and some carry 10-oz boxes; if you can only find the 10-oz boxes, you'll need three of them. If you'd like to start with fresh spinach, you'll need about 2 pounds baby spinach leaves. Steam and drain the baby spinach, then roughly chop and measure out 2 packed cups.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/creamed-spinach.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Make-Ahead Instructions: This dish can be made and refrigerated a day ahead of time. {"@context": "http://schema.org", "@id": "ouac-fv-recipe-28941", "@type": "Recipe", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Jennifer Segal "}, "name": "Rainbow Sprinkle Funfetti Cake", "description": "NutritionInformation", "servingSize": "", "calories": "771", "fatContent": "28 g", "carbohydrateContent": "128 g", "proteinContent": "6 g", "saturatedFatContent": "17 g", "unsaturatedFatContent": "", "sugarContent": "106 g", "fiberContent": "1 g", "sodiumContent": "292 mg", "cholesterolContent": "124 mg"}, "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 350\u00b0F and set an oven rack in the middle position. Spray two 8-inch cake pans with nonstick cooking spray. Cut two 8-inch rounds of parchment paper and line the bottom of each pan, then spray the paper with nonstick cooking spray. (To measure the parchment paper, just trace the bottom of the pan.)", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/rainbow-sprinkle-funfetti-cake.html#fv-recipe-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Set aside.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/rainbow-sprinkle-funfetti-cake.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment (or beaters), cream the butter and sugar on medium speed (or medium-high speed if using a hand-held mixer) until light and fluffy, about 2 minutes. Scrape the bowl once during this process to make sure everything is evenly combined. Scrape the sides of the bowl again.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/rainbow-sprinkle-funfetti-cake.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "With the mixer on low, add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Don't worry if the batter looks curdled at any point during the mixing process. Mix in the vanilla, then increase the speed to medium (or medium-high if using a hand-held mixer) and beat until the mixture is light and fluffy, about one minute. Scrape the bowl and briefly mix again.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/rainbow-sprinkle-funfetti-cake.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "On low speed, alternately add the whisked dry ingredients in three additions and the buttermilk in two: dry, wet, dry, wet, dry. When everything is just incorporated, remove the bowl from the mixer. Scrape the bowl as necessary, and fold in the sprinkles by hand using a spatula.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/rainbow-sprinkle-funfetti-cake.html#fv-recipe-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour the batter evenly into the cake pans and use the back of the spatula to smooth the batter and bake for 30 to 35 minutes, or until the cakes are golden and set, a cake tester inserted into the middle comes out clean, and the edges are pulling away from the pan.\r\nCool the cakes in the pans on a rack for about 20 minutes. When the pans are cool enough to handle, run an offset spatula or a knife around the rim, and turn the cakes out onto the rack. Let fully cool.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/rainbow-sprinkle-funfetti-cake.html#fv-recipe-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Once the cake layers are cool, use a long serrated knife to cut off the domed top of the cake layers so that they are flat. Discard (or snack on) the domed top. Repeat with the additional layer, and set aside.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/rainbow-sprinkle-funfetti-cake.html#fv-recipe-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Put one cake layer on a cake stand or serving platter with the cut-side up. Put about 1 cup of the frosting in the center and, using the the back of an offset spatula (or a butter knife, if you don't have an offset spatula), spread the frosting evenly just to the edge of the cake. Add the second cake layer on top of the first, so that the cut-side is down (and the bottom of the cake is on top). Scoop about 1 cup of the frosting onto the center of the cake and spread it to the edge. Get eye level with the cake to make sure that everything looks even. Put a \u00bc-cup blob of frosting on the side of the cake, and use your offset spatula to spread it over a section of cake. Rotate the cake stand as you go. Repeat until the entire side of the cake is covered fully. Don't worry about making the frosting too perfect; you will smooth it out again later, and the sprinkles will cover any imperfections.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/rainbow-sprinkle-funfetti-cake.html#fv-recipe-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place the cake, uncovered, in the refrigerator for 15 to 30 minutes to set. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/rainbow-sprinkle-funfetti-cake.html#fv-recipe-step-9"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove the cake from the refrigerator. If you touch the frosting, you will notice that it has formed a skin; that's normal. Place the cake next to the sink and turn on the hot water. Hold an offset spatula (or butter knife, if you don't have an offset spatula) under the hot water for a few seconds to warm it. Tap off any excess water, and then slowly run the hot spatula over an area of frosting until it is smooth and glossy. Continue this process over the entire cake, warming the spatula under hot water as necessary, until the cake is smooth and glossy all over. This process both evens out any bumps in the frosting and also creates a \"sticky\" surface for the sprinkles to adhere.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/rainbow-sprinkle-funfetti-cake.html#fv-recipe-step-10"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place the cake stand on a 13 x 18-inch sheet pan. This will catch the falling sprinkles. Fill a small bowl with about the sprinkles. Gather a handful of sprinkles in the palm of your hand and gently press them into the side of the cake, working from the base of the cake to the top edge, opening your palm as you go. Stop at the edge and don\u2019t \u201cround the corner\u201d onto the top of the cake. You want to keep those side edges sharp.  Rotate the cake stand in your hand and repeat, going all the way around. Gather another large handful of sprinkles and sprinkle them over the top of the cake. (I like to use a wide metal spatula to gently press the sprinkles into the frosting to even out any remaining bumps.) Scrape any \"fallen\" sprinkles off of the cake stand and wipe the edges of the cake stand clean with a damp paper towel, if necessary. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/rainbow-sprinkle-funfetti-cake.html#fv-recipe-step-11"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment (or beaters), beat the butter and cream cheese until creamy and evenly combined, about 30 seconds. With the mixer on low speed, gradually add the confectioners' sugar until incorporated, then beat in the vanilla and salt. Increase the speed to medium-high (or high speed if using a hand-held mixer) and beat until fluffy, about 1 minute.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/rainbow-sprinkle-funfetti-cake.html#fv-recipe-step-12"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Freezer-Friendly Instructions: The cake can be frozen, without frosting, for up to 3 months. After it is completely cooled, double-wrap it securely with aluminum foil or plastic freezer wrap, or place it in a heavy-duty freezer bag. She said they were \"undetectable\" from regular flour cookies.\r\n\r\nWhat I do differently:  I form the balls and place on a parchment lined cookie sheet.  Then place the sheet(s) into the FREEZER, making sure they lie flat so that the dough balls don't \"slide\" and bunch together.  I let them sit in freezer for no more than 10 minutes.  Bake in preheated oven as directed.  Hint:  I do transfer the dough balls to another tray that is room temp.\r\nOr you can place the bowl of cookie dough in the FRIDGE, to allow to chill but I would do no more than 25 to 30 minutes.  I like to work with dough that is firm but not hard.\r\n\r\nEither way, the GF version of this recipe is sinfully good!  Enjoy!\r\n\r\nP.S.  I do the same for my GF chocolate chip cookies.  I do flatten them just a tad before baking, doing the same for this recipe.  I've had lots of success making the GF version of any of Jenn's recipes that I've made. Stir, allowing the residual heat in the bowl to melt the remaining chocolate completely. (If necessary, place the chocolate back in microwave for a few seconds.) (If you don't have a mini food processor, pass the yolks through a sieve before combining them with the other ingredients. This will make them easier to blend without getting lumps.) "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Jennifer Segal, adapted from Bon App\u00e9tit"}, "name": "Pear & Dried Cherry Crisp with Walnut Streusel", "description": "A comforting combination of sweet pear & tart dried cherries, plumped up in an orange-scented caramel syrup.", "prepTime": "PT0M", "cookTime": "PT0M", "totalTime": "PT1H", "nutrition": {"@type": "NutritionInformation", "servingSize": "", "calories": "471", "fatContent": "25 g", "carbohydrateContent": "61 g", "proteinContent": "4 g", "saturatedFatContent": "11 g", "unsaturatedFatContent": "", "sugarContent": "41 g", "fiberContent": "6 dish (I use a small 1\u00bd quart ceramic oval dish, but an 8 x 8 square baking dish will also work).", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pear-dried-cherry-crisp-with-walnut-streusel.html#fv-recipe-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Make the streusel: Whisk together the flour, sugar, nutmeg, cinnamon and salt in a medium bowl. Add the butter and rub it in with your fingertips until the mixture begins to clump together. Stir in the walnuts. Cover and refrigerate.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pear-dried-cherry-crisp-with-walnut-streusel.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Make the Filling: Combine the sugar, butter, orange juice, orange zest, vanilla and salt in a medium pan. Stir over medium-high heat until the mixture comes to a boil. Add the dried cherries, then reduce the heat to medium and simmer until the cherries begin to soften and the liquid is caramel colored and thickened, 2-3 minutes. Remove from the heat, then add the pears (it's important to do this right away, as the pears cool the mixture and prevent it from over-caramelizing); stir until the pears are evenly coated with caramel sauce.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pear-dried-cherry-crisp-with-walnut-streusel.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Transfer the fruit mixture to the prepared baking dish and sprinkle the streusel mixture evenly over top. Bake for 45-50 minutes, until the pears are tender and the top is crisp and golden. Serve warm or room temperature with lightly sweetened <a href=\"https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/whipped-cream.html\">whipped cream</a> or <a href=\"https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/vanilla-ice-cream.html\">vanilla ice cream</a>.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pear-dried-cherry-crisp-with-walnut-streusel.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "<strong>Note:</strong> This dessert is best served warm out of the oven. You can prepare the streusel and fruit filling ahead of time, but keep them separate in the fridge. When you're ready to serve, top the fruit with the streusel and bake as directed. The recipe can easily be doubled and made in a 9x13-inch baking dish.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pear-dried-cherry-crisp-with-walnut-streusel.html#fv-recipe-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "<strong>Freezer-Friendly Instructions:</strong> The crisp can be frozen tightly covered for up to 3 months.  Before serving, reheat it, uncovered, in a 300\u00b0F oven until heated through and crisp on top.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pear-dried-cherry-crisp-with-walnut-streusel.html#fv-recipe-step-6"}], "recipeIngredient": ["\u00bd cup plus 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour, spooned into measuring cup and leveled-off ", "\u00bc cup plus 2 tablespoons sugar", "\u00bd teaspoon nutmeg", "\u00bd teaspoon cinnamon", "\u215b teaspoon salt", "6 tablespoons cold unsalted butter, cut into \u00bc-inch pieces", "\u00be cup coarsely chopped walnuts", "3 tablespoons sugar", "2 tablespoons unsalted butter", "2 tablespoons orange juice", "1 teaspoon orange zest", "\u00bd teaspoon vanilla", "\u215b teaspoon salt", "\u00bd cup dried cherries", "4 large D'Anjou pears, peeled and cut into 1-inch chunks (about 4 cups)", " Lightly sweetened whipped cream or vanilla ice cream, for serving (optional)"], "recipeYield": "6", "image": ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2013/10/Pear-and-Dried-Cherry-Crisp-with-Walnut-Streusel2.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2013/10/Pear-and-Dried-Cherry-Crisp-with-Walnut-Streusel2-500x376.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2013/10/Pear-and-Dried-Cherry-Crisp-with-Walnut-Streusel2-500x375.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2013/10/Pear-and-Dried-Cherry-Crisp-with-Walnut-Streusel2-480x270.jpg"], "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": 4.71, "ratingCount": "7"}, "datePublished": "2013-11-03T13:48:16-05:00", "keywords": "A La Mode, Christmas, Comfort Food, Dried Fruit, Nuts, Oranges, Pears, Thanksgiving", "recipeCuisine": "American", "recipeCategory": "Recipes"}]

Press the dough gently into the pan so it fits snugly without stretching. Trim the edges to extend about \u00bd inch (1.25 cm) beyond the pan\u2019s lip. Crimp the edges with a fork or flute them with your fingers for a decorative finish. Refrigerate until ready to fill, up to 1 day ahead. If using a frozen crust in an aluminum pan, keep frozen until you\u2019re ready to fill it.If using a homemade pie crust dough: Roll the dough into a 12 to 13-inch (30 to 33-cm) circle on a lightly floured surface. "HowToStep", "text": "In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, salt, 1 teaspoon of the cinnamon and the nutmeg.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/grandma-annies-chocolate-chip-mandel-bread.html#fv-recipe-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In the bowl of an electric mixer, combine the melted butter, 1 cup of the sugar, the vanilla extract and almond extract. Beat on medium speed until combined. Add the eggs and continue beating on medium speed until thickened and pale yellow, 2 to 3 minutes. Add the dry ingredients and mix on low speed until just incorporated, then mix in the chocolate chips and nuts (if using). Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and place in the refrigerator to chill until firm, 1 to 2 hours.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/grandma-annies-chocolate-chip-mandel-bread.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 350\u00b0F and set two oven racks in the centermost positions. Line two baking sheets with parchment paper. Lightly dust a clean work surface with flour and shape the dough into 2 logs about 2 inches wide, 13 inches long, and 1 inch tall. Place the logs on the prepared baking sheets. Bake for about 25 minutes, or until lightly golden, rotating the pans from top to bottom and front to back midway through. Remove the pans from the oven and place on cooling racks. Let the baked logs cool for 15 minutes. Lower the oven temperature to 250\u00b0F. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/grandma-annies-chocolate-chip-mandel-bread.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a small bowl, mix together the remaining 1 tablespoon of sugar and \u00bc teaspoon cinnamon. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/grandma-annies-chocolate-chip-mandel-bread.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Once the logs have cooled, cut them diagonally into \u00be-inch-thick slices (I do this directly on the baking sheets, but you can transfer the logs to a cutting board, if you'd like). Flip the cookies onto their sides, and then sprinkle half of the cinnamon-sugar over top. Flip the cookies over and repeat with the remaining cinnamon-sugar. Place the pan back in the oven (be sure the temperature has reached 250\u00b0F) and bake until golden and crisp, 40 to 45 minutes. Let the mandel bread cool on the baking sheets on the cooling racks, then store in airtight container at room temperature for up to two weeks. (Note: the cookies will get crunchier as they cool.)", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/grandma-annies-chocolate-chip-mandel-bread.html#fv-recipe-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "<strong>Freezer-Friendly Instructions:</strong> The dough can be frozen for up to 3 months: Shape the dough into logs, wrap each securely in plastic wrap, and place them in a sealable bag. When ready to bake, remove the logs from the freezer, thaw the dough until pliable, and then proceed with recipe. To freeze after baking: After the cookies are completely cooled, double-wrap them securely with aluminum foil or plastic freezer wrap. Thaw overnight on the countertop before serving. "http://schema.org", "@id": "ouac-fv-recipe-7579", "@type": "Recipe", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Jennifer Segal"}, "name": "Pumpkin Cheesecake", "description": "A holiday-ready pumpkin "fiberContent": "1g", "sodiumContent": "397mg", "cholesterolContent": "196mg"}, "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 325\u00b0F degrees and set a rack in the lower middle position. Wrap a 9- or 10-in springform pan with with one large piece of heavy-duty aluminum foil, covering the underside and extending all the way to the top so there are no seams on the bottom or sides of the pan. Repeat with another sheet of foil for insurance. Spray the inside of the pan with nonstick cooking spray. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pumpkin-cheesecake.html#fv-recipe-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Make the crust: Pulse the gingersnaps, sugar, and melted butter in a food processor fitted with the metal blade until finely ground. Transfer the moistened crumbs into the prepared pan and  press into an even layer. Bake until fragrant and set, about 15 minutes. Cool on a wire rack while you prepare the filling.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pumpkin-cheesecake.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Prepare the filling: Set a kettle of water to boil (this will be used for the water bath). In a small, heavy saucepan, stir together the pumpkin, sugar, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg, cloves, and salt. Over medium heat, bring the mixture to a sputter, stirring constantly. Reduce the heat to medium-low and cook, stirring constantly, for 5 minutes, until thick, bronzed and shiny. Scrape the mixture into a large food processor fitted with the metal blade and process for 1 minute with the feed tube open.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pumpkin-cheesecake.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "With the motor running, add the cold cream. Add the cream cheese (cut into chunks) and process for about 30 seconds, scraping the sides if necessary, or until smoothly incorporated. Add the eggs and process for about 5 seconds or just until incorporated (do not overmix!).", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pumpkin-cheesecake.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake: Set the cake pan in a large roasting pan. Pour the batter into the cooled crust, and then pour enough boiling water into the large roasting pan to come about halfway up side of the cake pan. Bake until the cake is just set, 1\u00bd to 1\u00be hours. A properly cooked cheesecake will jiggle a bit when you nudge the pan, but if the center seems at all liquidy, it's not done. Carefully remove the roasting pan from the oven and set on a wire rack. Run a sharp paring knife around the edges to loosen the cake from the sides of the pan. Cool until the water is just warm, about 45 minutes. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pumpkin-cheesecake.html#fv-recipe-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Finish cooling and chill: Remove the springform pan from the water bath, discard the foil and set on a wire rack. Continue to cool at room temperature until barely warm, about 3 hours. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate until chilled, at least 4 hours or overnight.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pumpkin-cheesecake.html#fv-recipe-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To Serve: Remove the outer ring from the springform pan. Slide a thin metal spatula between the crust and pan bottom to loosen, then slide the cheesecake onto a serving platter. (Alternatively, you can keep it on the pan bottom.) If there is condensation on the top of the cheesecake, blot it gently with a flat paper towel. Let the cheesecake stand at room temperature for about 30 minutes, then cut it into wedges. Warm up the caramel sauce in the microwave (it stiffens in the fridge). If it's too thick, add more heavy cream to thin it out. Drizzle the caramel sauce over each piece of cheesecake and top with a dollop of sweetened whipped cream if desired.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pumpkin-cheesecake.html#fv-recipe-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "<strong>Note:</strong> You'll need a large food processor\u2014 preferably with a 14-cup capacity\u2014to make the filling (you can also use an 11-cup, but you may have a bit of leakage). If you don't have one, it's fine to use a KitchenAid Mixer or electric beaters for the filling and a small food processor for the crust.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pumpkin-cheesecake.html#fv-recipe-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "<strong>Freezer-Friendly Instructions:</strong>  The cheesecake can be frozen for up to 3 months. To freeze: place the cake in the freezer briefly, unwrapped, to firm it up. Then double-wrap it tightly with aluminum foil or plastic freezer wrap, or place it in heavy-duty freezer bag.  Thaw in the refrigerator the night before you plan to eat it. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pumpkin-cheesecake.html#fv-recipe-step-9"}], "recipeIngredient": ["7\u00bd oz gingersnaps (or 1\u00bd cups finely ground gingersnap crumbs)", "\u00bc cup granulated sugar", "4 tablespoons  unsalted butter, melted", "1 (15-oz) can pumpkin (such as Libby's)", "1\u2153 cups granulated sugar", "1 teaspoon ground cinnamon", "\u00bd teaspoon ground ginger", "\u00bc teaspoon ground nutmeg", "\u00bc teaspoon ground cloves", "\u00bd teaspoon salt", "1 cup heavy cream, cold", "1\u00bd lb (three 8-oz packages) cream cheese, room temperature", "5 large eggs, room temperature", " Caramel sauce, for serving", " Special equipment: 9- or 10-in springform pan; 18-in heavy-duty aluminum foil"], "recipeYield": "Makes one {9- or 10-inch|23- or 25-cm} cake, serving 12", "image": ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2012/11/Pumpkin-Cheesecake_Gingernsap_Crust_Caramel_Sauce-2-1200x1636.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2012/11/Pumpkin-Cheesecake_Gingernsap_Crust_Caramel_Sauce-2-500x500.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2012/11/Pumpkin-Cheesecake_Gingernsap_Crust_Caramel_Sauce-2-500x375.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2012/11/Pumpkin-Cheesecake_Gingernsap_Crust_Caramel_Sauce-2-480x270.jpg"], "citation": "Inspired by many sources, including Ruth Levy Beranbaum and Cooks Illustrated", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": 4.83, "ratingCount": "278"}, "datePublished": "2022-11-19T11:46:14-05:00", "keywords": "Corn Syrup, Cream Cheese, Fall, Halloween, Lemons, Springform Pan, Thanksgiving, Winter", "recipeCuisine": "American", "recipeCategory": "Recipes"}]

["https://www.onceuponachef.com/about-jenn-segal"]}, {"@type": "Recipe", "name": "Chicken Pot Pie", "author": {"@id": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/#/schema/person/d09ca52c9e790675f71c46404845af62"}, "description": "Take your comfort food to the next level with individual chicken pot pies. Made with rotisserie chicken and store-bought puff pastry, they\u2019re as simple to make as they are delicious.", "datePublished": "2024-11-28T14:03:08+00:00", "image": ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2017/10/Chicken-Pot-Pie-2.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2017/10/Chicken-Pot-Pie-2-500x500.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2017/10/Chicken-Pot-Pie-2-500x375.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2017/10/Chicken-Pot-Pie-2-480x270.jpg"], "recipeYield": ["4", "4 to 6"], "prepTime": "PT30M", "cookTime": "PT40M", "totalTime": "PT70M", "recipeIngredient": ["1 to 2  packages frozen puff pastry, (best quality such as Dufour or Pepperidge Farm, thawed (see note))", "4 tablespoons unsalted butter", "1  medium yellow onion, (diced)", "3 cloves garlic, (roughly chopped)", "3  stalks celery, (diced)", "1 cup frozen pearl onions ((no need to defrost))", "3  carrots, (sliced into \u00bc-in (6-mm) rounds)", "1/3 cup all-purpose flour, (plus more for rolling the pastry)", "2\u00bd cups low-sodium chicken broth", "\u00bc cup Cognac or brandy ((okay to replace with more chicken broth if avoiding alcohol))", "\u00be teaspoon salt", "\u00bd teaspoon white pepper", "\u00bd cup heavy cream", "1 tablespoon chopped fresh thyme ((or a combination of thyme, rosemary and sage), plus a few thyme sprigs for serving)", "3 to 4 cups shredded cooked chicken, (from 1 rotisserie chicken)", "1 cup frozen peas ((no need to defrost))", "1  egg"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil for easy clean-up.", "name": "Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil for easy clean-up.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chicken-pot-pie.html#wprm-recipe-76396-step-0-0"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Dust a clean, dry work surface with flour and place the puff pastry over top. Sprinkle the pastry with flour and roll\u00a0to about \u215b-in (3-mm) thick, smoothing the creases with the rolling pin at the same time. (Depending on the brand of puff pastry you buy, you may not need to roll it out that much.) Using a sharp knife, kitchen shears, or a pizza cutter, cut out 4 circles about 2 in (5 cm) larger than the diameter of your soup bowls. (Alternatively, cut out 6 circles if making smaller portions.) Place the dough rounds on the foil-lined baking sheet and refrigerate until ready to use.", "name": "Dust a clean, dry work surface with flour and place the puff pastry over top. Sprinkle the pastry with flour and roll\u00a0to about \u215b-in (3-mm) thick, smoothing the creases with the rolling pin at the same time. (Depending on the brand of puff pastry you buy, you may not need to roll it out that much.) Using a sharp knife, kitchen shears, or a pizza cutter, cut out 4 circles about 2 in (5 cm) larger than the diameter of your soup bowls. (Alternatively, cut out 6 circles if making smaller portions.) Place the dough rounds on the foil-lined baking sheet and refrigerate until ready to use.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chicken-pot-pie.html#wprm-recipe-76396-step-0-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 425\u00b0F (220\u00b0C) and set an oven rack to the center position.", "name": "Preheat the oven to 425\u00b0F (220\u00b0C) and set an oven rack to the center position.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chicken-pot-pie.html#wprm-recipe-76396-step-0-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To make the filling: In a large saut\u00e9 pan over medium heat, melt the butter. Add the yellow onion, garlic, celery, pearl onions, and carrots. Saut\u00e9, stirring occasionally, until the carrots are just cooked, 8 to 10 minutes. Add the flour and cook, stirring constantly, for about 2 minutes. Add the broth, cognac, salt, and white pepper. Bring to a boil, stirring with a wooden spoon and scraping the bottom and corners of the pan to incorporate the flour. Simmer until thickened, a few minutes. Off the heat, stir in the heavy cream, thyme, chicken, and peas. Taste and adjust seasoning, if necessary. (Note that the broth will taste a little boozy at this point. That's okay - the cognac will cook off in the oven.)", "name": "To make the filling: In a large saut\u00e9 pan over medium heat, melt the butter. Add the yellow onion, garlic, celery, pearl onions, and carrots. Saut\u00e9, stirring occasionally, until the carrots are just cooked, 8 to 10 minutes. Add the flour and cook, stirring constantly, for about 2 minutes. Add the broth, cognac, salt, and white pepper. Bring to a boil, stirring with a wooden spoon and scraping the bottom and corners of the pan to incorporate the flour. Simmer until thickened, a few minutes. Off the heat, stir in the heavy cream, thyme, chicken, and peas. Taste and adjust seasoning, if necessary. (Note that the broth will taste a little boozy at this point. That's okay - the cognac will cook off in the oven.)", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chicken-pot-pie.html#wprm-recipe-76396-step-0-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Ladle the filling into 4 large or 6 small oven-safe soup bowls. Cool on the baking sheet. (The nuts can be toasted and stored at room temperature.)", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pecan-shortbread-cookies.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, cream the butter, confectioners' sugar, vanilla, and salt until smooth and lightened a bit, two to three minutes. Scrape the bowl with a spatula. Add the flour and mix on low just until fully combined. Add the pecans and mix until evenly combined. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pecan-shortbread-cookies.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Turn the dough onto a clean countertop lightly dusted with flour. Dust the dough with a little flour. Shape and roll into a squared log between 1\u00bd to 2 inches wide and 1\u00bd to 2 inches high, dusting with more flour as necessary. Wrap the dough in plastic wrap or parchment paper and chill for at least one hour or overnight, until the dough has gotten very firm.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pecan-shortbread-cookies.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 350\u00b0F and set two oven racks in the centermost positions. Line two baking sheets with parchment paper.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pecan-shortbread-cookies.html#fv-recipe-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Lightly beat the egg yolk and \u00bd teaspoon of water in a small bowl and set aside. Pour the demerara sugar into a rimmed baking sheet or shallow casserole pan. Slice the chilled log in half to make it more manageable. Working with one log at a time, brush all sides of the log with the egg yolk mixture, then roll in the demerara sugar, pressing as necessary, until fully coated. If there are any areas of the log that are bare, sprinkle with the demerara sugar to cover.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pecan-shortbread-cookies.html#fv-recipe-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Use a serrated knife to slice each log into about 12 individual cookies, each about \u00bd-inch thick. Place the cookie slices onto the prepared baking sheets, leaving about 2 inches of space between each. Bake, rotating from top to bottom and front to back halfway through, until lightly golden, 18 to 20 minutes. Let the cookies cool on the baking sheets for a few minutes, then transfer to a rack to cool completely. The cookies will keep in a covered container at room temperature for up to a week.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pecan-shortbread-cookies.html#fv-recipe-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "<strong>Freezer-Friendly Instructions:</strong> Let the cookies cool completely and store in an airtight container separating layers with parchment paper or aluminum foil. Before serving, remove the cookies from the container and let them come to room temperature. If you'd like to freeze the dough before baking, shape it into a squared log, then wrap it securely in plastic wrap and then a layer of foil; freeze for up to 3 months. When ready to bake, remove the log from the freezer, thaw it until pliable, and then proceed with recipe.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pecan-shortbread-cookies.html#fv-recipe-step-8"}], "recipeIngredient": ["\u00be cup  chopped pecans", "10 tablespoons (1\u00bc sticks)  unsalted butter, softened", "\u00bd cup  confectioners' sugar", "2 teaspoons  vanilla extract", "Scant \u00be teaspoon  kosher salt", "1\u00bd cups  all-purpose flour, spooned into measuring cup and leveled-off with a knife, plus more for dusting", "1  egg yolk, beaten", "\u00bc cup  demerara or turbinado sugar (Note: You'll use less than this, but you need extra to roll the dough in.)"], "recipeYield": "24 cookies", "image": ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2020/03/Pecan-Shortbread-Cookies-1200x1569.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2020/03/Pecan-Shortbread-Cookies-scaled-500x500.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2020/03/Pecan-Shortbread-Cookies-scaled-500x375.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2020/03/Pecan-Shortbread-Cookies-scaled-480x270.jpg"], "citation": "Adapted from <a href=\"https://unpeeledjournal.com/pecan-sugar-shortbread-cookies/\">Unpeeled</a> by Lisa Kolb Ruland", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": 4.78, "ratingCount": "110"}, "datePublished": "2020-04-08T08:02:29-04:00", "keywords": "All Seasons, Christmas, Easter, For the Host/Hostess, New Year's Day, Nuts", "recipeCuisine": "American", "recipeCategory": "Recipes"}]

chopped)", "\u00bc cup + 2 tablespoons sugar", "\u00bd teaspoon vanilla extract", "1/8 teaspoon salt", "1  large egg", "1 tablespoon all-purpose flour"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToSection", "name": "For the Cookie Dough", "itemListElement": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In medium bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder and salt.", "name": "In medium bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder and salt.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chocolate-filled-hamantaschen.html#wprm-recipe-77449-step-0-0"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In the bowl of an electric mixer, beat the butter and sugar until light and fluffy, about 3 minutes. Scrape down the sides of the bowl with a rubber spatula, then beat in the egg, egg yolk, and vanilla. On low speed, beat in the flour mixture until just incorporated, scraping down the sides of the bowl as necessary. Scrape the dough onto a very lightly floured surface (just a few pinches of flour) and knead with your hands a few times until smooth. Divide the dough into 2 pieces and form each into a 6-in (15-cm) disc. Wrap each disc in plastic wrap and refrigerate until firm enough to roll, a few hours or overnight.", "name": "In the bowl of an electric mixer, beat the butter and sugar until light and fluffy, about 3 minutes. Scrape down the sides of the bowl with a rubber spatula, then beat in the egg, egg yolk, and vanilla. On low speed, beat in the flour mixture until just incorporated, scraping down the sides of the bowl as necessary. Scrape the dough onto a very lightly floured surface (just a few pinches of flour) and knead with your hands a few times until smooth. Divide the dough into 2 pieces and form each into a 6-in (15-cm) disc. Wrap each disc in plastic wrap and refrigerate until firm enough to roll, a few hours or overnight.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chocolate-filled-hamantaschen.html#wprm-recipe-77449-step-0-1"}]}, {"@type": "HowToSection", "name": "For the Chocolate Filling", "itemListElement": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place the butter in a medium microwave-safe bowl. Microwave on high until melted, about one minute. Add the chopped chocolate and stir until the mixture is completely melted and smooth (zap again in the microwave for 20 seconds if necessary). Stir in the sugar, vanilla and salt. The mixture will look grainy -- that's okay. Add the egg and stir until incorporated. Stir in the flour and beat with a spoon until the mixture is smooth, about 30 seconds. Cover and refrigerate until ready to use.", "name": "Place the butter in a medium microwave-safe bowl. Microwave on high until melted, about one minute. Add the chopped chocolate and stir until the mixture is completely melted and smooth (zap again in the microwave for 20 seconds if necessary). Stir in the sugar, vanilla and salt. The mixture will look grainy -- that's okay. Add the egg and stir until incorporated. Stir in the flour and beat with a spoon until the mixture is smooth, about 30 seconds. Cover and refrigerate until ready to use.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chocolate-filled-hamantaschen.html#wprm-recipe-77449-step-1-0"}]}, {"@type": "HowToSection", "name": "To Assemble", "itemListElement": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 350\u00b0F (175\u00b0C) and position racks in upper and lower thirds of the oven. Line two baking sheets with parchment paper.", "name": "Preheat oven to 350\u00b0F (175\u00b0C) and position racks in upper and lower thirds of the oven. Line two baking sheets with parchment paper.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chocolate-filled-hamantaschen.html#wprm-recipe-77449-step-2-0"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove 1 disc of dough from the refrigerator and let sit at room temperature until supple enough to roll, about 15 minutes. Place the dough on a very lightly floured work surface and knead with your hands a few times to soften it up. It will continue to soften as you work with it. Roll to about \u215b-in (3-mm) thick, turning and dusting with more pinches of flour as necessary. (Take care not to use too much flour, and don&#39;t worry if the dough starts to crack at the edges; just cut the cookies from the inside area. When you re-roll the scraps, the dough will be softer and less prone to cracking.) Using a cookie cutter or glass, cut out 3-in (7.5-cm) circles and place them about \u00bd-in (13-mm) apart on the prepared pans. Re-roll and re-cut any excess dough. Scoop and place a level teaspoon of the chocolate filling in the center of each cookie (do not overfill). Bring 3 sides of each cookie up to partially cover the filling, then firmly pinch the edges of the cookie to seal the corners and form a triangle. Place the unbaked hamantaschen in the freezer for 10 to 15 minutes to firm up (if your pans don&#39;t fit in your freezer, you can place them in the fridge for 30 minutes).", "name": "Remove 1 disc of dough from the refrigerator and let sit at room temperature until supple enough to roll, about 15 minutes. Place the dough on a very lightly floured work surface and knead with your hands a few times to soften it up. It will continue to soften as you work with it. Roll to about \u215b-in (3-mm) thick, turning and dusting with more pinches of flour as necessary. (Take care not to use too much flour, and don&#39;t worry if the dough starts to crack at the edges; just cut the cookies from the inside area. When you re-roll the scraps, the dough will be softer and less prone to cracking.) Using a cookie cutter or glass, cut out 3-in (7.5-cm) circles and place them about \u00bd-in (13-mm) apart on the prepared pans. Re-roll and re-cut any excess dough. Scoop and place a level teaspoon of the chocolate filling in the center of each cookie (do not overfill). Bring 3 sides of each cookie up to partially cover the filling, then firmly pinch the edges of the cookie to seal the corners and form a triangle. Place the unbaked hamantaschen in the freezer for 10 to 15 minutes to firm up (if your pans don&#39;t fit in your freezer, you can place them in the fridge for 30 minutes).", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chocolate-filled-hamantaschen.html#wprm-recipe-77449-step-2-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake for 12 minutes, turning the pans halfway through baking, until lightly golden around the edges. What did I do wrong?", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Rachel"}, "datePublished": "2019-03-15"}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "reviewBody": "Wonderful and fun to make!", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Olga"}, "datePublished": "2018-12-21"}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "reviewBody": "More notes:\nDough was allowed to rest in the refrigerator over night. Then frozen for 2 days. Can also be frozen for 3 months filled or not. No need to thaw just bake it frozen and add a few minutes more time.\nAbout 3-4 minutes. \nFollowed the softening procedure. Floured the board. Rolled out the dough (do not roll it too thin or it will break during baking). Use parchment paper baking pan.\nCut out circles of dough and lay it directly on the baking pan. After the pan is filled, \nplace the pan in the freezer for 5 to 7 minutes. This helps the dough relax and firm up a little ( since it\u2019s soft).  \nNow beat an egg. Take the dough circles out of the freezer.  Let it sit out for a minute. Brush the circle dough using a small brush with the beaten egg.  Fill the center with any filling. The egg is your glue.\nIf it\u2019s a fruit filling make sure it\u2019s not runny.\nIt can be made from dried fruits  and simmered in juice. Then pur\u00e9ed. \nNuts and chocolate is also very good.\nJenn\u2019s chocolate filling is excellent.\nForm the cookie in the pan. Less handling the better. Use a small offset spatula or knife to lift the sides to form the 3 corners and your fingers.. \nThe spatula helps keep the circles nice and neat. \nFreeze. \nBefore baking I brushed the hamantaschen with egg wash. \nThe dough is very good. \nThe recipe is very good. \nIt will go in my pink binder where my 5 star recipe is filed.\nThanks Jenn for this wonderful recipe.\nPS:\nNone of the 48 hamentaschen opened.\nThey are perfectly beautiful.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Monina S Naylor"}, "datePublished": "2018-06-03"}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "reviewBody": "Hi Jenn, \nJust found your site while searching for a hamantashen recipe that didn\u2019t use yeast. \nI have tried many before but was not happy with the result. \n3 batches of dough (1 at a time) were made today. \nMy favorite way of measuring is by using a scale. \nAs a practice, I always read and understand a recipe. That\u2019s how I was trained ( professional chef/Baker retired). \nFollowed the instructions as written and paying attention to the flour measuring method that you used. After measuring the 1st cup of flour, I weighed it on my scale in grams and oz. Then doubled the result. The weight for 2 cups of flour resulted to 258g (9.1 oz).\nSugar was 200g for 1 cup\nEggs at room temperature.\nButter is also at room temperature weighing 113 g (1/4 lb).\nI use a large plastic bag (orowheat bread bag from Costco and proceeded to add a 1/8 th of a teaspoon of all purpose flour.\nShaked the bag to distribute the flour then opened the plastic bag to shake out excess flour. Next I placed the dough in the bag and kneaded it. No extra flour needed during the process. Formed a large circle of dough, open bag cut it in half. \nForm 2 circles one at a time. It\u2019s the only time I handled the dough by hand. I didn\u2019t want it to warm up too much or add a lot of extra flour.\nEach of the 3 separate batches of dough came out the same in texture, suppleness.\nI would say at this stage my hands and eyes tell me it\u2019s going to be a good dough to work with.\nIt\u2019s now chilling in the refrigerator until tomorrow to allow it to relax. \nWill let you know the next stage. \nThanks for posting this recipe. "HowToStep", "text": "Blind Bake the Crust: If you\u2019re using a store-bought frozen crust, follow the blind-baking instructions on the package. If you\u2019re using a homemade crust, roll out the dough and gently fit it into a 9-inch deep-dish pie pan, making sure it\u2019s snug against the bottom and sides. Chill the crust for at least 30 minutes.Meanwhile, preheat the oven to 375\u00b0F and set an oven rack in the middle position. Place the chilled crust on a baking sheet (it makes it much easier to move in and out of the oven). Line the crust with a piece of parchment paper and fill it about three-quarters full with dried beans or pie weights.Bake for 20 minutes. Remove the crust from the oven, lift out the parchment and weights, and tent the edges with a few strips of foil folded in half lengthwise to keep them from getting too dark. Return the crust to the oven and bake for another 15 to 20 minutes, until the bottom looks dry and lightly golden. If it puffs up a bit, just press it down gently with a flat spatula\u2014try not to puncture it. Remove the foil, but keep it nearby in case you need it again later.After blind-baking the crust, reduce the oven temperature to 325\u00b0F.", "name": "Blind Bake the Crust: If you\u2019re using a store-bought frozen crust, follow the blind-baking instructions on the package. If you\u2019re using a homemade crust, roll out the dough and gently fit it into a 9-inch deep-dish pie pan, making sure it\u2019s snug against the bottom and sides. Chill the crust for at least 30 minutes.Meanwhile, preheat the oven to 375\u00b0F and set an oven rack in the middle position. Place the chilled crust on a baking sheet (it makes it much easier to move in and out of the oven). Line the crust with a piece of parchment paper and fill it about three-quarters full with dried beans or pie weights.Bake for 20 minutes. Remove the crust from the oven, lift out the parchment and weights, and tent the edges with a few strips of foil folded in half lengthwise to keep them from getting too dark. Return the crust to the oven and bake for another 15 to 20 minutes, until the bottom looks dry and lightly golden. If it puffs up a bit, just press it down gently with a flat spatula\u2014try not to puncture it. Remove the foil, but keep it nearby in case you need it again later.After blind-baking the crust, reduce the oven temperature to 325\u00b0F.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/perfect-pumpkin-pie.html#wprm-recipe-76491-step-0-0"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Make the Filling: In a large bowl, combine the pumpkin, egg, egg yolks, granulated sugar, brown sugar, flour, salt, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg, cloves, pepper, and evaporated milk. It should look dry around the edges, but the center should jiggle just slightly if you nudge the pan. Keep a close eye on the pie as it bakes; if ever the crust looks like it&#39;s browning too quickly, tent the edges with foil strips. Let the pie cool on a rack (leave it on the baking sheet) to room temperature, a few hours. Use a spoon to scoop the flesh into a mixing bowl. Repeat with the remaining avocado halves. Add the lime juice, salt, cumin, scallions, garlic (if using), and jalape\u00f1o. Using a fork, mash the mixture until blended but still very chunky. Add the tomatoes and cilantro and fold until combined, being careful not to overmix (you want the guacamole to be chunky). Taste and adjust seasoning with more salt, lime, or jalape\u00f1o, if desired. Transfer to a bowl and serve with tortilla chips. If not serving immediately, place a piece of plastic wrap directly over the surface of the guacamole and refrigerate until ready to serve (preferably no longer than a few hours; bring to room temperature before serving).", "name": "Hold an avocado half in the palm of your hand and, using a butter knife, cut a grid into the flesh. Taste and adjust seasoning with more salt, lime, or jalape\u00f1o, if desired. Transfer to a bowl and serve with tortilla chips. teaspoons fresh thyme leaves, (divided)", "1 tablespoon brown sugar", "4  large carrots, (peeled and cut into 1-inch (2.5-cm) chunks on a diagonal)", "\u00bd cup dried apricots", "1 pound sweet potatoes, (peeled and cut into 1-inch (2.5-cm) chunks)", "\u00bd cup prunes"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pat the beef dry and season with the salt and pepper. In a large Dutch oven or heavy soup pot, heat 1\u00bd tablespoons of the olive oil over medium-high heat until hot and shimmering. Place half of the beef in the pan and brown, turning with tongs, for about 5 minutes; add the remaining oil and brown the remaining beef. (To sear the meat properly, let the meat develop a nice brown crust before turning with tongs.) Transfer the meat to a large plate and set aside.", "name": "Pat the beef dry and season with the salt and pepper. In a large Dutch oven or heavy soup pot, heat 1\u00bd tablespoons of the olive oil over medium-high heat until hot and shimmering. Place half of the beef in the pan and brown, turning with tongs, for about 5 minutes; add the remaining oil and brown the remaining beef. (To sear the meat properly, let the meat develop a nice brown crust before turning with tongs.) Transfer the meat to a large plate and set aside.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/beef-tzimmes.html#wprm-recipe-72345-step-0-0"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the onions, garlic, and balsamic vinegar to the pot; cook, stirring with a wooden spoon and scraping the brown bits from the bottom of the pan, for about 5 minutes. Add the tomato paste and cook for 1 minute more. Add the beef with its juices back to the pan and sprinkle with the flour. Stir with the wooden spoon until the flour is dissolved, about 1 minute. Add the orange juice, water, beef broth, bay leaf, rosemary, 2 teaspoons of the thyme, and the sugar. Stir to loosen any brown bits from the bottom of the pan and bring to a boil. Cover the pot with a lid, reduce the heat to a simmer, and cook for 2 hours.", "name": "Add the onions, garlic, and balsamic vinegar to the pot; cook, stirring with a wooden spoon and scraping the brown bits from the bottom of the pan, for about 5 minutes. Add the tomato paste and cook for 1 minute more. Add the beef with its juices back to the pan and sprinkle with the flour. Stir with the wooden spoon until the flour is dissolved, about 1 minute. Add the orange juice, water, beef broth, bay leaf, rosemary, 2 teaspoons of the thyme, and the sugar. Stir to loosen any brown bits from the bottom of the pan and bring to a boil. Cover the pot with a lid, reduce the heat to a simmer, and cook for 2 hours.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/beef-tzimmes.html#wprm-recipe-72345-step-0-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the carrots and apricots. Cover and continue cooking for 30 minutes. Add the sweet potatoes and prunes and cook for 30 minutes more, or until all the vegetables and meat are tender. Fish out the bay leaf and rosemary sprigs and discard. Taste and adjust seasoning if necessary. Serve the stew or let it come to room temperature and then store in the refrigerator overnight or until ready to serve. The flavor of the stew improves if made at least 1 day ahead.) Reheat, covered, over medium heat until hot throughout. Garnish with the remaining fresh thyme leaves.", "name": "Add the carrots and apricots. Cover and continue cooking for 30 minutes. Add the sweet potatoes and prunes and cook for 30 minutes more, or until all the vegetables and meat are tender. Fish out the bay leaf and rosemary sprigs and discard.
