position. Toast the walnuts on a rimmed baking sheet until they\u2019re fragrant and golden brown, 10 to 15 minutes. Transfer the walnuts to a plate to cool. In a small bowl, mix together the walnuts, brown sugar, and cinnamon. Set aside.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/sour-cream-coffee-cake-with-cinnamon-walnut-swirl.html#fv-recipe-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Reduce the oven temperature to 300\u00b0F. Spray a 9- or 10-in Bundt pan with nonstick cooking spray and dust with flour. Tap out any excess flour. Alternatively, spray the pan with a nonstick spray with flour in it, such as Baker's Joy or Pam with Flour.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/sour-cream-coffee-cake-with-cinnamon-walnut-swirl.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, and salt. Set aside.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/sour-cream-coffee-cake-with-cinnamon-walnut-swirl.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment or beaters, combine the sugar and butter. Beat on medium speed until pale and fluffy, about 3 minutes. Add the eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition until the mixture is homogenous. On low speed, mix in the sour cream and vanilla. The batter will look a little curdled at this point; that's okay. Scrape down the sides and bottom of the bowl to make sure all of the ingredients are evenly incorporated.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/sour-cream-coffee-cake-with-cinnamon-walnut-swirl.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Gradually add the flour mixture and mix on low speed until the batter is smooth and homogeneous.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/sour-cream-coffee-cake-with-cinnamon-walnut-swirl.html#fv-recipe-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Scoop \u2153 of the batter into the prepared pan. (It won't seem like enough, especially if you're using a 10-in Bundt -- that's okay. Just do your best to smooth it into an even layer with a spatula or back of a spoon.) Sprinkle half of the cinnamon-walnut mixture evenly over the batter. Cover with another \u2153 of the remaining batter, using a spoon or spatula to spread the batter evenly over the pan and to the edges. Sprinkle the remaining nut mixture evenly over the batter and cover with the remaining batter, spreading it evenly over the nut mixture.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/sour-cream-coffee-cake-with-cinnamon-walnut-swirl.html#fv-recipe-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake for 65 to 75 minutes, until the cake is golden and a cake tester comes out clean. Cool the cake in the pan for 15 minutes. Do not let the cake cool in the pan for much longer than this or the brown sugar in the streusel might stick to the sides of the pan and make it difficult to release the cake. Place a wire rack on top of the Bundt pan and then invert the pan to release the cake. Let the cake cool completely before serving.  The cake will keep well in an airtight container at room temperature for up to a week. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/sour-cream-coffee-cake-with-cinnamon-walnut-swirl.html#fv-recipe-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "<strong>Freezer-Friendly Instructions:</strong> The cake can be frozen for up to 3 months. "recipeIngredient": ["2\u00bd cups all-purpose flour, (spooned into measuring cup and leveled-off)", "6 tablespoons sugar", "Heaping \u00bc teaspoon salt", "1 cup (2 sticks) cold unsalted butter, cut into 1-in (2.5-cm) chunks", "6 oz cold cream cheese, cut into 1-in (2.5-cm) chunks", "1  egg yolk", "8 oz semi-sweet chocolate, (best quality such as Ghiradelli, roughly chopped)", "\u00bd cup sugar", "\u00bc teaspoon salt"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Make the dough: Place the flour, sugar, and salt in the bowl of a food processor fitted with a metal blade. Pulse a few times to combine. Add the chunks of butter, cream cheese, and egg yolk. Process until the dough starts to come together into a well-moistened, crumbly mass, 20 to 30 seconds. Transfer the dough to a clean work surface. Gather the crumbly dough into a ball and knead, dusting the work surface and dough lightly with flour as necessary, until it comes together into a smooth ball. Shape the dough into a rectangle, then cut into 4 equal portions; flatten each piece of dough into a \u00bd-in (2.5-cm)-thick rectangle. Wrap each section of dough in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 1 hour or up to 3 days.", "name": "Make the dough: Place the flour, sugar, and salt in the bowl of a food processor fitted with a metal blade. Pulse a few times to combine. Add the chunks of butter, cream cheese, and egg yolk. Process until the dough starts to come together into a well-moistened, crumbly mass, 20 to 30 seconds. Transfer the dough to a clean work surface. Gather the crumbly dough into a ball and knead, dusting the work surface and dough lightly with flour as necessary, until it comes together into a smooth ball. Shape the dough into a rectangle, then cut into 4 equal portions; flatten each piece of dough into a \u00bd-in (2.5-cm)-thick rectangle. Wrap each section of dough in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 1 hour or up to 3 days.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chocolate-rugelach.html#wprm-recipe-77351-step-0-0"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Make the filling: Place the chocolate in a medium microwave-safe bowl. Melt in the microwave in 30-second intervals, stirring in between, until almost melted. Stir, allowing the residual heat in the bowl to melt the chocolate completely. (Alternatively, melt the chocolates in a double boiler on the stovetop.) Mix in the sugar and salt. The mixture will be grainy; that's okay.", "name": "Make the filling: Place the chocolate in a medium microwave-safe bowl. Melt in the microwave in 30-second intervals, stirring in between, until almost melted. Stir, allowing the residual heat in the bowl to melt the chocolate completely. (Alternatively, melt the chocolates in a double boiler on the stovetop.) Mix in the sugar and salt. The mixture will be grainy; that's okay.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chocolate-rugelach.html#wprm-recipe-77351-step-0-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.", "name": "Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chocolate-rugelach.html#wprm-recipe-77351-step-0-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Roll the cookies: Remove one section of dough from the refrigerator, unwrap it, and place it on a lightly floured work surface. (If necessary, let it sit at room temperature for a few minutes until it&#39;s pliable enough to roll, but not too soft.) Dust the top of the dough lightly with flour, then use a rolling pin to roll it into an 8 x 11-in (20 x 28-cm) rectangle. Don&#39;t make yourself crazy over it, but try to make it as even as possible around the edges; it will make it easier to roll. (Go ahead and trim slightly with a pizza cutter or sharp knife if it&#39;s very uneven.) Using an offset spatula or back of a spoon, quickly spread \u00bc of the chocolate filling (about a \u00bc cup) evenly over the dough, leaving a \u00bc-in (6-mm) border around the edges.", "name": "Roll the cookies: Remove one section of dough from the refrigerator, unwrap it, and place it on a lightly floured work surface. (If necessary, let it sit at room temperature for a few minutes until it&#39;s pliable enough to roll, but not too soft.) Dust the top of the dough lightly with flour, then use a rolling pin to roll it into an 8 x 11-in (20 x 28-cm) rectangle. Don&#39;t make yourself crazy over it, but try to make it as even as possible around the edges; it will make it easier to roll. (Go ahead and trim slightly with a pizza cutter or sharp knife if it&#39;s very uneven.) Using an offset spatula or back of a spoon, quickly spread \u00bc of the chocolate filling (about a \u00bc cup) evenly over the dough, leaving a \u00bc-in (6-mm) border around the edges.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chocolate-rugelach.html#wprm-recipe-77351-step-0-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Starting from the long side, roll the dough tightly into a cylinder. Place the filled rolled dough, seam side down, on the prepared baking sheet. Repeat with the remaining dough and chocolate filling. Place the rolled dough logs in the refrigerator for 20 to 30 minutes, or until firm to the touch.", "name": "Starting from the long side, roll the dough tightly into a cylinder. Place the rolled dough logs in the refrigerator for 20 to 30 minutes, or until firm to the touch.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chocolate-rugelach.html#wprm-recipe-77351-step-0-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 375\u00b0F (190\u00b0C).", "name": "Preheat the oven to 375\u00b0F (190\u00b0C).", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chocolate-rugelach.html#wprm-recipe-77351-step-0-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Take the rolled dough out of the refrigerator. Using a serrated knife, slice off the uneven ends of each roll and discard. Then slice the rolls into 1-in (2.5-cm)-wide pieces. Place each slice, seam side down, on the prepared sheet. Bake for 18 to 20 minutes, or until lightly golden. Cool the rugelach on the baking sheet for a few minutes, then transfer to a rack to cool completely. Rugelach are best enjoyed fresh on the day they are baked but any extra cookies can be stored in airtight container for up to 3 days, or frozen for longer storage.", "name": "Take the rolled dough out of the refrigerator. Bake for 18 to 20 minutes, or until lightly golden. Cool the rugelach on the baking sheet for a few minutes, then transfer to a rack to cool completely. Rugelach are best enjoyed fresh on the day they are baked but any extra cookies can be stored in airtight container for up to 3 days, or frozen for longer storage.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chocolate-rugelach.html#wprm-recipe-77351-step-0-6"}], "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": "4.39", "ratingCount": "34", "reviewCount": "10"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "reviewBody": "I have made Jenn\u2019s Chocolate Rugelach several times and have received rave reviews from friends and family.  However, I always get stressed out trying to form the dough into 4 equal portions after processing it in my food processor.  I have found that the easiest and stress-free method for me to accomplish this task is by dividing the crumbly dough into 4 equal sections before kneading the dough. I weigh each portion on my kitchen scale to assure that each is approximately equal.  Including the small paper bowls that I use to hold each portion, each portion weighs about 7.7 ounces.  Aside from assuring that each portion is equal, it is easier for me to manipulate the smaller portion than the entire dough.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Nancy D"}, "datePublished": "2025-01-29"}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "2"}, "reviewBody": "I'm unhappy at the moment with this recipe because the chocolate hardened almost  immediately as I was trying to spread it. When the instructions say to spread the chocolate quickly, definitely go quickly! Luckily you have 4 tries so I learned my lesson after the chocolate hardened on my first roll. I think the rolls should also be cold when you bake it, my first messed up roll burned on the bottom and was raw in the middle\u2014this was the only batch I didn\u2019t put back in the fridge before baking. You know its a good recipe when even the messed up batch still tastes very good lol. "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To make the bagels, line a baking sheet with parchment paper and scatter the cornmeal evenly across the paper. Set aside.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/montreal-bagels.html#fv-recipe-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place the bowl of a stand mixer on a kitchen scale and tare the weight to zero. Measure in the flour, water, honey, oil, salt, and yeast. Place the bowl back on the stand mixer and fit it with the dough hook. On low speed, mix the ingredients together until there are no dry patches of flour showing.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/montreal-bagels.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Stop to scrape down the sides of the bowl and increase the speed to medium. Mix until the sides of the bowl are nearly clean, 2 to 3 minutes. The dough may seem dry. Cover the bowl with a clean tea towel and let the dough rest for 10 minutes to allow the flour to hydrate evenly.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/montreal-bagels.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Uncover the bowl, turn the mixer speed to medium, and let it run for 5 full minutes, until the dough is smooth and satiny and the sides of the bowl are clean.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/montreal-bagels.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Scrape the dough onto a clean, unfloured work surface and give it five or six kneads. Divide the dough into six equal pieces, each weighing about 97 g. Shape the bagels and stretch the center hole with the thumbs and forefingers of both hands. These will be rougher looking than New York bagels, uneven and bumpy. One at a time, form and place the bagels on the prepared baking sheet. Cover the baking sheet tightly with plastic wrap that has been lightly coated with cooking spray and set in a cool place to rise until slightly puffed, about 1 hour.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/montreal-bagels.html#fv-recipe-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "About 15 minutes before the rise is over, place a pizza stone, Baking Steel, or inverted baking sheet on the oven\u2019s center rack and set the oven to 400\u00b0F.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/montreal-bagels.html#fv-recipe-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To prepare the topping, pour the seeds, if using, into a pie pan or another shallow dish.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/montreal-bagels.html#fv-recipe-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To make the water bath, add the water and honey to a 5 qt or larger pot and bring it to a hard boil. Place a 9 by 13 in piece of parchment on a pizza peel, large cutting board, or a baking sheet flipped over. (You need to be able to easily slide the bagel-laden parchment paper from this surface into the oven.)", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/montreal-bagels.html#fv-recipe-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "The bagels will have risen to only about 50 percent more than their starting size. Gently lift one at a time, brushing away any excess cornmeal, and drop it into the boiling water. Repeat with another one or two bagels only if they fit in the pot without crowding. Using a slotted spoon or spider, flip the bagels over and over in the water until very slightly puffed, about 60 seconds and no more than 90 seconds.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/montreal-bagels.html#fv-recipe-step-9"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Transfer each bagel to the pan of seeds, using a chopstick to flip the bagel so the seeds stick to both sides, then move it to the parchment paper on the pizza peel. Repeat with the remaining bagels; six bagels will fit snugly on the parchment paper without touching.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/montreal-bagels.html#fv-recipe-step-10"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Slide the parchment paper with the bagels directly onto the hot surface in the oven and bake until lightly golden brown and shiny, 16 to 20 minutes. To remove the bagels from the oven, slide the parchment paper right onto the peel. Transfer on their paper to a wire rack to cool.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/montreal-bagels.html#fv-recipe-step-11"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "As tempting as it is to grab the hot bagels immediately, allow them to cool slightly before eating. store-bought refrigerated crust that is already rolled, simply unroll it, and fit it into a 9-inch by 1\u00bd-inch  (23-cm by 4-cm) deep-dish pie pan. Press the dough gently into the pan to ensure it fits snugly without stretching. Trim the edges of the dough to extend about \u00bd inch beyond the pie pan&#39;s lip. Crimp the edges with a fork or flute them with your fingers to create a decorative edge. Refrigerate until ready to fill, up to 1 day ahead of time. If using a frozen crust, keep it in the freezer until you are ready to fill it.", "name": "If using a store-bought refrigerated crust that is already rolled, simply unroll it, and fit it into a 9-inch by 1\u00bd-inch  (23-cm by 4-cm) deep-dish pie pan. Carefully lift the dough by draping it over your rolling pin, then transfer it to the pie pan. Gently press the dough into the pan, ensuring it is smoothly eased into place without stretching. Trim the edges of the dough to extend about \u00bd inch (13 mm) beyond the pie pan&#39;s lip. Crimp the edges with a fork or flute them with your fingers to create a decorative edge. Carefully lift the dough by draping it over your rolling pin, then transfer it to the pie pan. Gently press the dough into the pan, ensuring it is smoothly eased into place without stretching. (This acts like a pizza stone, providing a hot surface to help the bottom crust of the pie crisp up effectively.)", "name": "Preheat the Oven: Preheat the oven to 350\u00b0F (175\u00b0C) and set an oven rack in the lower third position. Place a baking sheet on this rack to preheat as well. (This acts like a pizza stone, providing a hot surface to help the bottom crust of the pie crisp up effectively.)", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/bourbon-brown-butter-pecan-pie.html#wprm-recipe-72940-step-0-2"}]}, {"@type": "HowToSection", "name": "Make the Filling", "itemListElement": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a small saucepan over medium heat, melt the butter and cook, swirling the pan occasionally, until the butter smells nutty and is golden brown, 3 to 5 minutes. Once you smell that nutty aroma, take the pan off the heat and pour the browned butter into a large heat-proof bowl to cool. (The milk solids will darken and settle on the bottom of the saucepan. When you transfer the brown butter to the bowl, try to leave as much of this sediment in the pan as possible but don't worry about it too much.)", "name": "In a small saucepan over medium heat, melt the butter and cook, swirling the pan occasionally, until the butter smells nutty and is golden brown, 3 to 5 minutes. Once you smell that nutty aroma, take the pan off the heat and pour the browned butter into a large heat-proof bowl to cool. (The milk solids will darken and settle on the bottom of the saucepan. When you transfer the brown butter to the bowl, try to leave as much of this sediment in the pan as possible but don't worry about it too much.)", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/bourbon-brown-butter-pecan-pie.html#wprm-recipe-72940-step-1-0"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To the bowl with the brown butter, add the brown sugar, corn syrup, and golden syrup and whisk until smooth. If you've set aside a few whole pecan halves, arrange them on top in a decorative pattern, pressing them slightly into the filling before letting them rise back up to ensure they're coated. Brush the edges of the pie crust with the beaten egg, milk, or cream.", "name": "Sprinkle the pecans in the pie crust and then pour the syrup mixture over top. Sprinkle on the bread crumb mixture. Add the cocoa powder and stir until dissolved. Add one cup of the banana bread batter to the melted chocolate and stir until well combined.  ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/marbled-chocolate-banana-bread.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Spoon the plain batter and chocolate batter alternately into the prepared loaf pan. Swirl the batters together with a knife (don't overdo it or the colors will get muddled -- up and back 4 to 5 times should suffice). Bake for about 1 hour and 10 minutes, or until a cake tester comes out clean. Cool in the pan on a wire rack for about 10 minutes, then remove the loaf from the pan and set on the wire rack to cool completely. Enjoy them warm from the oven in all their rich, buttery goodness.", "prepTime": "PT15M", "cookTime": "PT20M", "totalTime": "PT35M", "nutrition": {"@type": "NutritionInformation", "servingSize": "1 biscuit", "calories": "272", "fatContent": "16 g", "carbohydrateContent": "28 g", "proteinContent": "3 g", "saturatedFatContent": "10 g", "unsaturatedFatContent": "", "sugarContent": "2 g", "fiberContent": "1 g", "sodiumContent": "172 mg", "cholesterolContent": "42 mg"}, "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 425\u00baF and set an oven rack in the middle position. Line a 13x18-inch baking sheet with parchment paper.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/drop-biscuits.html#fv-recipe-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, cornstarch, baking powder, baking soda, sugar, and salt. Add the butter and, using a pastry cutter, cut the butter into the dry ingredients until the mixture resembles coarse sand with a few pea-sized clumps of butter intact. (Alternatively, you can use your fingertips to rub the butter into the mixture.) Add \u00be cup of the buttermilk and stir with a rubber spatula until the dough comes together into a shaggy, sticky mass. Add the remaining \u00bc cup buttermilk, a little at a time, until the dough is moistened (you may not need all of it). Do not over-mix.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/drop-biscuits.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using two soup spoons, scoop 8 peach-size mounds (about 2\u00bd inches) of the biscuit dough onto the prepared baking sheets, spacing them evenly apart. Do not compact the mounds or try to make them smooth on top; they are meant to have an irregular shape. Bake for 17 to 20 minutes, until the biscuits are lightly golden. Brush the biscuits with melted butter, if you like. The biscuits are best served warm out of the oven (though a few minutes in the oven will revive slightly older biscuits). Once cool, freeze any biscuits you don't plan to serve right away. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/drop-biscuits.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Freezer-Friendly Instructions: The biscuits can be frozen, unbaked, for up to 3 months. If unbaked prior to freezing, put the biscuits on a baking sheet, pop them in the freezer for about an hour or until they are no longer tacky, and then put then in a resealable freezer bag. Bake without thawing, but allow a few extra minutes in the oven. It should be the consistency of maple syrup -- it will continue to thicken as it cools. Remove the sauce from the heat and cool. Before serving, place the cake back in the oven with the toffee sauce and proceed with the recipe from there. Chill the soup in the refrigerator for about an hour, or until very cold. ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2024/07/Homemade-Pasta-Hero-4.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2024/07/Homemade-Pasta-Hero-4-500x500.jpg", "PT30M", "totalTime": "PT30M", "recipeIngredient": ["2 cups all-purpose flour or \u00a0tipo \u201c00\u201d flour, (spooned into measuring cup and leveled off )", "3  large eggs", "1 teaspoon extra-virgin olive oil", "1/2 teaspoon salt"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Stand-Mixer Method: In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, combine the flour, eggs, oil, and salt. Mix on medium-low speed (setting 2) for 2 to 3 minutes until the dough comes together. It will seem dry at first, but it should eventually come together into a cohesive mass. If it seems dry, you can add another teaspoon of oil but give it a chance to mix for the full 3 minutes before deciding if it&#39;s needed. If the dough seems wet, you can add more flour 1 tablespoon at a time. Once the dough has come together, switch to the dough hook attachment and knead it on medium-low speed (setting 2) for 10 minutes until the dough is smooth and elastic. If the dough is sticking to the bottom of the bowl during kneading, add more flour, little by little, until it no longer sticks.By-Hand Method: In a large bowl, mix the flour and salt. Make a well in the center, and add the eggs and oil. Using a fork, beat together the eggs and oil, then incorporate the flour, starting with the inner rim of the well, until a shaggy dough forms. Turn the dough out onto a clean, lightly floured surface and knead it for about 10 minutes, adding more flour as needed to prevent sticking, until it becomes smooth and elastic. This process requires some effort, but it\u2019s essential for developing the gluten and creating a chewy, resilient pasta.", "name": "Stand-Mixer Method: In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, combine the flour, eggs, oil, and salt. Mix on medium-low speed (setting 2) for 2 to 3 minutes until the dough comes together. It will seem dry at first, but it should eventually come together into a cohesive mass. If it seems dry, you can add another teaspoon of oil but give it a chance to mix for the full 3 minutes before deciding if it&#39;s needed. If the dough seems wet, you can add more flour 1 tablespoon at a time. Once the dough has come together, switch to the dough hook attachment and knead it on medium-low speed (setting 2) for 10 minutes until the dough is smooth and elastic. If the dough is sticking to the bottom of the bowl during kneading, add more flour, little by little, until it no longer sticks.By-Hand Method: In a large bowl, mix the flour and salt. Make a well in the center, and add the eggs and oil. Using a fork, beat together the eggs and oil, then incorporate the flour, starting with the inner rim of the well, until a shaggy dough forms. Turn the dough out onto a clean, lightly floured surface and knead it for about 10 minutes, adding more flour as needed to prevent sticking, until it becomes smooth and elastic. This process requires some effort, but it\u2019s essential for developing the gluten and creating a chewy, resilient pasta.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/homemade-pasta.html#wprm-recipe-55896-step-0-0"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "After kneading, wrap the dough in plastic wrap and let it rest at room temperature for 30 minutes. This rest period allows the gluten to relax, making it easier to roll out. If you need to store the dough for longer, you can refrigerate it for up to 2 days, but let it sit at room temperature for about 30 minutes before rolling.", "name": "After kneading, wrap the dough in plastic wrap and let it rest at room temperature for 30 minutes. This rest period allows the gluten to relax, making it easier to roll out. If you need to store the dough for longer, you can refrigerate it for up to 2 days, but let it sit at room temperature for about 30 minutes before rolling.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/homemade-pasta.html#wprm-recipe-55896-step-0-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Divide the rested dough into four pieces. Flour your work surface lightly to prevent sticking. Take one piece at a time and flatten it into a rough rectangle with your hands. Set your pasta machine to its widest setting and pass the dough through the rollers two times. Fold the dough into thirds, like a letter you\u2019re mailing, and pass it through the widest setting again. Repeat this process again, lightly dusting with flour to prevent sticking. Gradually decrease the roller setting, passing the dough through each setting twice and dusting with flour each time, until it reaches your desired thickness. (For fettuccine and other longer noodles, aim for a thickness of about 1/16 inch.)*If you don\u2019t have a pasta machine, you can roll the dough out by hand. Working on a clean, well-floured surface, use a rolling pin to roll the dough to your desired thickness, turning and dusting it with flour to prevent sticking.", "name": "Divide the rested dough into four pieces. Flour your work surface lightly to prevent sticking. Take one piece at a time and flatten it into a rough rectangle with your hands. Set your pasta machine to its widest setting and pass the dough through the rollers two times. Fold the dough into thirds, like a letter you\u2019re mailing, and pass it through the widest setting again. Repeat this process again, lightly dusting with flour to prevent sticking. Gradually decrease the roller setting, passing the dough through each setting twice and dusting with flour each time, until it reaches your desired thickness. (For fettuccine and other longer noodles, aim for a thickness of about 1/16 inch.)*If you don\u2019t have a pasta machine, you can roll the dough out by hand. Working on a clean, well-floured surface, use a rolling pin to roll the dough to your desired thickness, turning and dusting it with flour to prevent sticking.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/homemade-pasta.html#wprm-recipe-55896-step-0-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Once rolled into sheets, cut the pasta into your desired shape. You can use the attachments on your pasta machine, a knife, or a pizza cutter. Dust the cut pasta with flour to prevent it from sticking together, and store on a baking sheet. For longer noodles, like fettuccine or tagliatelle, form them into nests. It&#39;s best to cook the pasta within 30 minutes of making it. If you need to store it, cover it tightly with plastic wrap and refrigerate for up to 2 days or freeze for up to 2 months.", "name": "Once rolled into sheets, cut the pasta into your desired shape. You can use the attachments on your pasta machine, a knife, or a pizza cutter. Dust the cut pasta with flour to prevent it from sticking together, and store on a baking sheet. For longer noodles, like fettuccine or tagliatelle, form them into nests. It&#39;s best to cook the pasta within 30 minutes of making it. If you need to store it, cover it tightly with plastic wrap and refrigerate for up to 2 days or freeze for up to 2 months.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/homemade-pasta.html#wprm-recipe-55896-step-0-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To Cook: Bring a large pot of salted water to a rolling boil. Add the pasta, stir gently with a wooden spoon, and cook, tasting at regular intervals until the noodles are just cooked with a little bite, 1 to 2 minutes for thin noodles and 2 to 3 minutes for thicker noodles. Drain, reserving some of the pasta cooking water; toss with the sauce, adding a bit of the starchy cooking water to achieve the desired consistency, and serve.", "name": "To Cook: Bring a large pot of salted water to a rolling boil. "fiberContent": "3 g", "sodiumContent": "2,139 mg", "cholesterolContent": "432 mg"}, "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Heat 1 tablespoon of the oil in a large (5-qt) Dutch oven or heavy-bottomed pot over medium heat. Add the pancetta and cook until the fat has rendered and the pancetta is crispy, 5 to 8 minutes. Using a slotted spoon, transfer the pancetta to a paper-towel-lined plate, leaving the fat in the pan.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/coq-au-vin.html#fv-recipe-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Season the chicken all over with 2 teaspoons salt and \u00bd teaspoon pepper. Increase the heat to medium-high and brown half of the chicken in a single layer, skin side down, until golden and crispy, about 5 minutes (brown on the skin side only). Using tongs, transfer the chicken to a plate; set aside. Repeat with the remaining chicken. Pour off all but about 2 tablespoons of the fat.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/coq-au-vin.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Return the pot to the stove and reduce the heat to medium-low. Add the onions to the pot and cook, stirring occasionally, until the onions are softened and just starting to brown, 3 to 5 minutes. Add the garlic and cook, stirring constantly, until fragrant, about 1 minute more. Add the Cognac and cook, stirring to scrape the brown bits from the bottom of the pan, until the Cognac has evaporated. Add the wine, chicken broth, tomato paste, balsamic vinegar, sugar, thyme, bay leaf, and \u00bd teaspoon salt. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to medium and gently boil, uncovered, for 15 minutes.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/coq-au-vin.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the chicken and any accumulated juices from the plate back to the pot, along with the carrots. Bring to a simmer, then cover and cook over low heat for 30 minutes, or until the chicken and carrots are cooked through.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/coq-au-vin.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "While the chicken cooks, heat the remaining 2 tablespoons of oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the mushrooms and \u00bc teaspoon salt and cook, stirring frequently, until the mushrooms are golden brown, about 5 minutes. Set aside.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/coq-au-vin.html#fv-recipe-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Also while the chicken cooks: In a small bowl, mash the softened butter and flour to make a smooth paste. Set aside.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/coq-au-vin.html#fv-recipe-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a slotted spoon, transfer the cooked chicken to a plate. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/coq-au-vin.html#fv-recipe-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Increase the heat in the Dutch oven/pot to medium and stir in three-quarters of the flour and butter paste. Gently boil until the sauce is thickened, 5 to 7 minutes; add the remaining paste if you'd like the sauce a little thicker. Fish out and discard the bay leaf. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/coq-au-vin.html#fv-recipe-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a fork and knife, pull the skin off of the chicken and discard. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/coq-au-vin.html#fv-recipe-step-9"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the chicken and any accumulated juices back to the pot and simmer, uncovered, for about 10 minutes. Right before serving, stir in the browned mushrooms and pancetta. Taste and adjust seasoning, if necessary, then serve.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/coq-au-vin.html#fv-recipe-step-10"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Note: Sometimes chicken thighs have excess skin and/or fat. Before cooking, using kitchen shears, trim any skin that extends farther than the edges of the chicken thigh, and snip off any excess fat. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/coq-au-vin.html#fv-recipe-step-11"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Make-Ahead Instructions: Let cool to room temperature and then store in the refrigerator for up to 2 days. Reheat over medium-low heat on the stovetop before serving. (For best results, store the saut\u00e9ed mushrooms and crispy pancetta in separate containers in the refrigerator and add before serving.)", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/coq-au-vin.html#fv-recipe-step-12"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Freezer-Friendly Instructions: This can be frozen for up to 3 months. Before serving, defrost the stew in the refrigerator for 24 hours and then reheat on the stovetop over medium-low heat until hot.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/coq-au-vin.html#fv-recipe-step-13"}], "recipeIngredient": ["3 tablespoons olive oil, divided", "4 ounces diced pancetta (or bacon)", "8  bone-in, skin-on chicken thighs (about 4 pounds), trimmed of excess skin (see note)", " Salt", " Freshly ground black pepper", "1  large yellow onion, roughly chopped", "4 cloves garlic, roughly chopped ", "\u00bc cup Cognac", "2\u00bd cups red wine, preferably Burgundy or Pinot Noir", "2\u00bd cups chicken broth", "1\u00bd tablespoons  tomato paste", "2 teaspoons balsamic vinegar", "1\u00bd teaspoons sugar ", "1 tablespoon  fresh thyme leaves (or 1 teaspoon dried)", "1  bay leaf", "3 large carrots, peeled and cut into \u00bd-inch chunks on the bias", "8 ounces sliced cremini mushrooms", "4 tablespoons  unsalted butter, softened", "4 tablespoons all-purpose flour "], "recipeYield": "4", "image": ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2020/01/Coq_au_vin-1200x1576.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2020/01/Coq_au_vin-scaled-500x500.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2020/01/Coq_au_vin-scaled-500x375.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2020/01/Coq_au_vin-scaled-480x270.jpg"], "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": 4.92, "ratingCount": "298"}, "datePublished": "2020-01-15T14:54:09-05:00", "keywords": "Carrots, Chicken Thighs, Christmas, Comfort Food, Cookbook 2 Recipe, Fall, Mushrooms, Pancetta, Red Wine, Stew, Winter", "recipeCuisine": "French", "recipeCategory": "Recipes"}]

(Don't wash the pan but scrape out every last bit of vegetables, otherwise they will burn in the next step.)", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/sausage-herb-stuffing.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In the same pan, cook the sausage over medium heat for 8-10 minutes, until browned and cooked through, breaking up the sausage with a metal spatula while cooking (the largest pieces should be no greater than \u00bc-inch). Pure Butter Shortbread Cookies, or similar, broken into \u00bc-inch pieces"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a medium saucepan, whisk the sugar, cornstarch, salt, and egg yolks. Whisk in the milk and bring to simmer, stirring frequently, over medium heat (it will take 5 to 8 minutes). When the mixture starts to bubble, turn the heat down to low and continue cooking, whisking constantly, for 1 to 2 minutes until the mixture thickens. Remove the pan from the heat and immediately whisk in the butter, vanilla and rum. Transfer the mixture to a bowl and place a piece of plastic wrap directly over the pudding to prevent a film from forming. Chill in the refrigerator until cool, a few hours. (To hurry it up, you can place the bowl in an ice bath and whisk occasionally until cold.)", "name": "In a medium saucepan, whisk the sugar, cornstarch, salt, and egg yolks. Whisk in the milk and bring to simmer, stirring frequently, over medium heat (it will take 5 to 8 minutes). When the mixture starts to bubble, turn the heat down to low and continue cooking, whisking constantly, for 1 to 2 minutes until the mixture thickens. Remove the pan from the heat and immediately whisk in the butter, vanilla and rum. Transfer the mixture to a bowl and place a piece of plastic wrap directly over the pudding to prevent a film from forming. Chill in the refrigerator until cool, a few hours. (To hurry it up, you can place the bowl in an ice bath and whisk occasionally until cold.)", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/banana-pudding-parfaits.html#wprm-recipe-72251-step-0-0"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Once the pudding is cold, place the heavy cream in a medium mixing bowl. Using an electric mixer, whip on medium-low speed until the whisk or beaters begin to leave tracks in the cream. Add the confectioners' sugar and whip until the cream holds medium, silky peaks. Go slowly towards the end; if it gets grainy or curdled, you\u2019ve gone too far. Use a rubber spatula to fold the whipped cream into the cold pudding.", "name": "Once the pudding is cold, place the heavy cream in a medium mixing bowl. Using an electric mixer, whip on medium-low speed until the whisk or beaters begin to leave tracks in the cream. Add the confectioners' sugar and whip until the cream holds medium, silky peaks. Go slowly towards the end; if it gets grainy or curdled, you\u2019ve gone too far. Use a rubber spatula to fold the whipped cream into the cold pudding.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/banana-pudding-parfaits.html#wprm-recipe-72251-step-0-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Spoon a large dollop of the pudding mixture into the bottom of each parfait glass. Refrigerate for at least 3 hours or up to 12 hours.", "name": "Spoon a large dollop of the pudding mixture into the bottom of each parfait glass. Any ideas what could have gone wrong?\r\nCarolyn", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Carolyn"}, "datePublished": "2024-01-11"}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "reviewBody": "Even after being forgotten in the fridge for two days, the pudding was still good but a little lumpy from having solidified.  I whipped up the cream and afterwards I used the same mixer whisk to smooth out the pudding.  I made a banana cream pie with shortbread crust and layered it just the same as if it were in a parfait glass.  The Walkers shortbread brought a whole new dimension to it, perfect combo of smooth pudding with just a hint of rum to kick it up a notch and ripe bananas and the crunch of a really good crumbly cookie.  I had enough left over to put in two ramekins ( bought for Jenn\u2019s warm lemon pudding cakes which are also spoon licking excellent). Bring to a boil over high heat, then remove the pan from the heat, cover, and let stand for 10 minutes. Place the hard-boiled eggs in a bowl of cold water to cool (I usually just use the saucepan). ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/deviled-eggs.html#fv-recipe-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Once cool, tap each egg on the counter to crack the shell, then peel under cold running water. Slice the eggs in half lengthwise. Using a small spoon, gently remove the yolks and place them in a small bowl. Arrange the whites on a serving platter, gently wiping them clean if necessary. Using a spatula, push the egg yolks through a mesh sieve, then mash with the mayonnaise, vinegar, mustard, Worcestershire sauce, salt, black pepper, sugar, cayenne pepper, and herbs. (Passing the yolks through a sieve makes them much easier to mash without getting lumps but if you don\u2019t want to bother, you can mix the yolks with the other filling ingredients - minus the herbs - in a food processor.) Taste and adjust seasoning, if necessary.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/deviled-eggs.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Fill a piping bag fitted with an open star or large plain tip with the yolk mixture. (Alternatively, fill a sealable plastic bag with the yolk mixture, and use your hand to gently push the mixture to one corner of the bag. Use scissors to snip off the tip of the corner, opening up a \u00bc\u2013in [6-mm] hole.) Pipe the yolk mixture evenly into the egg white halves. (For a less fussy preparation, simply spoon the yolk mixture into the egg whites.) Sprinkle with paprika and more fresh herbs.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/deviled-eggs.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Make-Ahead: The whole eggs can be cooked and stored whole in the refrigerator several days ahead of time. The empty egg halves and filling mixture can be refrigerated separately, wrapped tightly in plastic wrap, for up to 2 days. Bring to room temperature and taste and adjust seasoning if necessary before filling. The eggs should be filled as close to serving time as possible.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/deviled-eggs.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}], "recipeIngredient": ["6  large eggs", "3 tablespoons mayonnaise, best quality such as Hellman\u2019s or Duke\u2019s", "1\u00bd teaspoons cider vinegar", "1 teaspoon whole grain mustard", "\u00bc teaspoon Worcestershire sauce", "\u215b teaspoon salt", "\u215b teaspoon freshly ground black pepper", "\u215b teaspoon sugar", "Pinch  cayenne pepper", "1 tablespoon finely chopped mixed herbs, such as chives, parsley, dill or tarragon, plus more for serving", " Paprika, for serving"], "recipeYield": "1 dozen filled egg halves", "image": ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2021/04/deviled-eggs-1200x746.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2021/04/deviled-eggs-500x500.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2021/04/deviled-eggs-500x375.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2021/04/deviled-eggs-480x270.jpg"], "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": 4.87, "ratingCount": "39"}, "datePublished": "2023-04-05T08:58:08-04:00", "keywords": "All Seasons, Easter, Hard Boiled Eggs, Mother's Day, New Year's Day, Passover, Potluck", "recipeCuisine": "American, Southern", "recipeCategory": "Recipes"}]

Let cool completely, then break into pieces with your hands. teaspoon salt", "1 (12-oz) bottle lager beer (see note)", "6  hoagie rolls or hot dog buns", "Coarse grain mustard", "Warm sauerkraut"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large (12-inch/30-cm) cast iron skillet or nonstick pan with a tight-fitting lid, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the bratwurst and sear until nicely browned, 2 to 3 minutes per side. Using tongs, transfer the sausage to a plate; set aside. Add the onions and salt to the skillet and cook, stirring frequently, until the onions are softened and golden brown, about 5 minutes (do not burn; reduce the heat if necessary).", "name": "In a large (12-inch/30-cm) cast iron skillet or nonstick pan with a tight-fitting lid, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the bratwurst and sear until nicely browned, 2 to 3 minutes per side. Using tongs, transfer the sausage to a plate; set aside. Reduce the heat to low, cover with the lid, and simmer for 10 minutes (at this point the sausages will be partially cooked through). Remove the cover, increase the heat to medium, and continue cooking until the bratwurst are cooked through and the beer is reduced by about three quarters, 10 to 12 minutes more. Serve the bratwurst and onions on rolls with mustard and sauerkraut, if desired.", "name": "Place the bratwurst back in the pan on top of the onions, add the beer, and bring to a boil. Cook over medium heat for about 30 minutes, or until the liquid is reduced by about half.", "name": "Melt 5 tablespoons of the butter in a medium saucepan. Add the shallots and cook over medium-low heat, stirring occasionally, until soft and translucent, 7 to 8 minutes. Add the wine, beef broth, thyme sprigs, salt, pepper and sugar, and bring to a boil. Cook over medium heat for about 30 minutes, or until the liquid is reduced by about half.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/roast-beef-tenderloin-wine-sauce.html#wprm-recipe-72336-step-0-0"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "While the liquid is reducing, place the remaining 3 tablespoons of butter in a small bowl and soften in the microwave, if necessary (it should be soft but not melted). Add the flour and, using a small spoon, mix into a smooth paste.", "name": "While the liquid is reducing, place the remaining 3 tablespoons of butter in a small bowl and soften in the microwave, if necessary (it should be soft but not melted). Add the flour and, using a small spoon, mix into a smooth paste.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/roast-beef-tenderloin-wine-sauce.html#wprm-recipe-72336-step-0-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Once the wine mixture is reduced, reduce the heat to low and remove the thyme sprigs. Whisk the flour-butter paste, a tablespoon at a time, into the simmering liquid, and simmer for a few minutes, until the sauce is thickened. Set aside. (The sauce can be made up to this point and refrigerated up to 3 days ahead of time.)", "name": "Once the wine mixture is reduced, reduce the heat to low and remove the thyme sprigs. (The sauce can be made up to this point and refrigerated up to 3 days ahead of time.)", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/roast-beef-tenderloin-wine-sauce.html#wprm-recipe-72336-step-0-2"}]}, {"@type": "HowToSection", "name": "For the Tenderloin", "itemListElement": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Let the beef stand at room temperature for 1 hour before roasting. Heat the oil in an oven-proof skillet over medium-high heat until almost smoking. Cook, turning with tongs, until well browned on all but one side, about 10 minutes total. Turn the tenderloin so that the un-seared side is down, and transfer the skillet directly to the preheated oven. (If your pan isn&#39;t oven-proof, transfer the beef to a lightly oiled roasting pan.) Roast until a thermometer inserted into the center of the meat registers 120\u00b0F to 125\u00b0 (49\u00b0C to 52\u00b0C) for medium rare, about 15 minutes, or until done to your liking (115\u00b0F to 120\u00b0F/46\u00b0C to 49\u00b0C for rare, 130\u00b0F to 135\u00b0F/54\u00b0C to 57\u00b0C for medium). Keep in mind that these temperatures account for the fact that the temperature will continue to rise about 5 degrees while the meat rests.", "name": "Season the beef all over with kosher salt and pepper. Repeat with the remaining portions of dough.", "name": "On a lightly floured work surface, cut the dough into 3 pieces. Work with one piece at a time, keeping the others wrapped and refrigerated. Roll the first portion of the dough into a log about \u00be-in (2-cm) in diameter. Cut each log into \u00bd-in (13-mm) pieces. Roll each piece into a ball, then roll the balls in granulated sugar to coat them completely. Place the balls on the prepared baking sheets, spacing about 1\u00bd in (4 cm) apart. Pour the cream into a medium microwave-safe bowl. Microwave on high until boiling, about 1 minute. Add the chocolate and butter; let sit for 1 minute, then whisk until smooth and glossy. (Alternatively, put the chocolate and butter in a medium bowl, bring the cream to a boil in a saucepan, and then pour the cream over the chocolate and butter.) Whisk in the rum, if using. Allow the ganache to cool, whisking it occasionally, until it is thickened enough to spread with a knife, about 45 minutes. (Don't let it cool for too long, or it will be too firm to spread.)", "name": "While the cookies are baking, make the ganache filling. Pour the cream into a medium microwave-safe bowl. Microwave on high until boiling, about 1 minute. Add the chocolate and butter; let sit for 1 minute, then whisk until smooth and glossy. (Alternatively, put the chocolate and butter in a medium bowl, bring the cream to a boil in a saucepan, and then pour the cream over the chocolate and butter.) Whisk in the rum, if using. Allow the ganache to cool, whisking it occasionally, until it is thickened enough to spread with a knife, about 45 minutes. (Don't let it cool for too long, or it will be too firm to spread.)", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chocolate-kisses-baci-di-cioccolato.html#wprm-recipe-77204-step-0-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheets for a few minutes, then use a spatula to transfer them to a rack to cool completely.", "name": "Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheets for a few minutes, then use a spatula to transfer them to a rack to cool completely.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chocolate-kisses-baci-di-cioccolato.html#wprm-recipe-77204-step-0-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To assemble the kisses: Pair up the cookies according to size. Turn one cookie upside down and, using a butter knife, spread a heaping teaspoon of the ganache onto the flat side, then place the bottom of the second cookie on the ganache to form a sandwich; the two round tops of the cookies should be facing outward. (Alternatively, use a pastry bag fitted with a plain or star tip to pipe the ganache onto the cookies.) Repeat until all the cookies have been used. Allow the ganache to firm up at room temperature for about an hour, then transfer the cookies to a serving plate.", "name": "To assemble the kisses: Pair up the cookies according to size. Turn one cookie upside down and, using a butter knife, spread a heaping teaspoon of the ganache onto the flat side, then place the bottom of the second cookie on the ganache to form a sandwich; the two round tops of the cookies should be facing outward. (Alternatively, use a pastry bag fitted with a plain or star tip to pipe the ganache onto the cookies.) Repeat until all the cookies have been used. "HowToStep", "text": "Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil (see note). Boil the corn until tender-crisp, 3 to 4 minutes. Do not overcook. Drain the corn and immerse it in very cold water to stop the cooking process.  Place the corn on a clean dish towel set over a cutting board, then use a serrated knife to cut the kernels of the cobs. (The dish towel both dries the corn and prevents it from bouncing all over the place.)", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/fresh-corn-salad.html#fv-recipe-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large bowl, combine the kernels with the oil, vinegar, scallions, salt, and pepper. Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve. Just before serving, toss in the fresh basil. Taste and adjust seasoning, if necessary. If the salad tastes too tart, add a bit more oil; if it tastes bland, add a bit more vinegar or salt and pepper. Try adding a \u00bc teaspoon of sugar if the corn isn't as sweet as you'd like. butter with the oil over medium-high heat. Add the onions, salt, pepper, and sugar. Cook, uncovered, stirring frequently with a wooden spoon, until the onions are slightly softened, 4 to 5 minutes.", "name": "In a large, heavy-bottomed skillet, melt the butter with the oil over medium-high heat. Add the onions, salt, pepper, and sugar. Cook, uncovered, stirring frequently with a wooden spoon, until the onions are slightly softened, 4 to 5 minutes.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/how-to/caramelized-onions.html#wprm-recipe-74987-step-0-0"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Reduce the heat to medium and continue cooking, uncovered and stirring occasionally, until the onions are a rich golden brown color. This process can take anywhere from 45 to 75 minutes. In the beginning, you will only need to stir the onions occasionally. However, as the onions cook down and begin to brown, you will need to stir them more frequently, scraping the fond (the brown particles) from the bottom of the pan. Towards the end of the caramelization process, the fond will start to stick to the pan, so you will need to occasionally deglaze the pan with a few tablespoons of water, scraping up the fond with a wooden spoon, to prevent burning and promote even caramelization. Repeat the deglazing process with the water as needed until caramelization is achieved. Once the onions have achieved the rich golden brown color, remove them from the skillet, let cool, and store in a covered container in the refrigerator.", "name": "Reduce the heat to medium and continue cooking, uncovered and stirring occasionally, until the onions are a rich golden brown color. This process can take anywhere from 45 to 75 minutes. In the beginning, you will only need to stir the onions occasionally. However, as the onions cook down and begin to brown, you will need to stir them more frequently, scraping the fond (the brown particles) from the bottom of the pan. Towards the end of the caramelization process, the fond will start to stick to the pan, so you will need to occasionally deglaze the pan with a few tablespoons of water, scraping up the fond with a wooden spoon, to prevent burning and promote even caramelization. Repeat the deglazing process with the water as needed until caramelization is achieved. Once the onions have achieved the rich golden brown color, remove them from the skillet, let cool, and store in a covered container in the refrigerator.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/how-to/caramelized-onions.html#wprm-recipe-74987-step-0-1"}], "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": "5", "ratingCount": "3", "reviewCount": "3"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "reviewBody": "I soften my onions on medium for eight minutes, turn down to medium low and stir every five minutes. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/meatloaf.html#fv-recipe-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Heat the oil in a medium skillet over medium heat. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/meatloaf.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To the bowl, add the milk, eggs, thyme, salt, pepper, and Worcestershire sauce. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/meatloaf.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the meatloaf mix and bread crumbs to the egg mixture and mix with your hands until just combined.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/meatloaf.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Form the mixture into 6 small (9-ounce) loaves and place on the prepared baking sheet. Spoon the ketchup over the top and sides of each loaf. Bake for 40 to 45 minutes, or until an instant-read thermometer registers 160\u00b0F in the middle of a meatloaf. Let the meatloaves rest for about 5 minutes. Scrape any fat away from the edges of each meatloaf, then use a spatula to transfer them to a serving platter or plates. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/meatloaf.html#fv-recipe-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Form the meat mixture into a 12 x 5-inch loaf shape directly on the prepared baking sheet. Spread the ketchup evenly over the top and sides of the loaf. Bake for 75 to 80 minutes, or until an instant-read thermometer registers 160\u00b0F in the middle of the meatloaf. Let the meatloaf rest for about 10 minutes. Scrape any fat away from the edges of the meatloaf (it will ooze out and brown while baking), then use a wide spatula to transfer the meatloaf to a cutting board or serving platter. Slice and serve.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/meatloaf.html#fv-recipe-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Note: Meatloaf mix is a combination of ground beef, pork, and veal that is more flavorful than ground beef alone. Most supermarkets carry meatloaf mix, but if you can\u2019t find it, equal parts ground beef and pork is a good substitute. If you don't cook with pork, go ahead and use ground chuck, which is 20% lean ground beef.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/meatloaf.html#fv-recipe-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Note: If making individual meatloaves, the trickiest part of this recipe is making the loaves of equal size. I usually divide the meat mixture roughly in half and then divide each half roughly into thirds. Then, I scoop large balls of the mixture onto the prepared baking sheet, reapportion if necessary, and then shape into loaves.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/meatloaf.html#fv-recipe-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Make-Ahead/Freezer-Friendly Instructions: You can refrigerate the uncooked loaf/loaves, covered, 1 day before you plan to bake them. Allow a few extra minutes in the oven if baking from cold. For already baked meatloaf/loaves, cool completely, wrap well, and refrigerate for up to 3 days or freeze for up to 3 months.  If frozen, defrost overnight in the refrigerator and then reheat, covered, on a baking sheet in a 300\u00b0F oven until hot in the middle. {"@context": "http://schema.org", "@id": "ouac-fv-recipe-20688", "@type": "Recipe", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Jennifer Segal"}, "name": "Classic New York Cheesecake Recipe", "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 375\u00b0F and set an oven rack in the lower middle position. Wrap a 9- or 10-inch springform pan with one large piece of heavy-duty aluminum foil, covering the underside and extending all the way to the top so there are no seams on the bottom or sides of the pan. Repeat with another sheet of foil for insurance. Spray the inside of the pan with nonstick cooking spray.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/new-york-style-cheesecake.html#fv-recipe-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Make the crust: In a medium bowl, combine the graham cracker crumbs, melted butter, sugar, and salt. Stir until well combined. Press the crumbs into an even layer on the the bottom of the prepared pan. Bake the crust for 10 minutes, until set. Remove the pan from the oven and set aside.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/new-york-style-cheesecake.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Reduce the oven temperature to 325\u00b0F. Set a kettle of water to boil.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/new-york-style-cheesecake.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Make the batter: In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment or beaters, beat the cream cheese, sugar, and flour together on medium speed until just smooth, about 1 minute. Scrape the bottom and sides of the bowl to be sure the mixture is evenly combined. Add the vanilla, lemon zest, lemon juice, and salt; beat on low speed until just combined. Add the eggs, one at a time, mixing on low speed until incorporated, scraping the bowl as necessary. Mix in the sour cream. Make sure the batter is uniform but do not over-mix.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/new-york-style-cheesecake.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Check to make sure your oven has cooled to 325\u00b0F, then set the cheesecake pan in a large roasting pan. Pour the batter on top of  the crust. Pour the boiling water into the large roasting pan to come about 1 inch up the side of the cake pan. Bake until the cake is just set, 1 hour and 30 minutes to 1 hour and 45 minutes. (If the cheesecake starts to look too golden on top towards the end, cover it loosely with foil.) The cake should not look liquidy at all but will wobble just a bit when the pan is nudged; it will continue to cook as it cools. Carefully remove the roasting pan from the oven and set it on a wire rack. Cool the cheesecake in the water bath until the water is just warm, about 45 minutes. Remove the springform pan from the water bath and discard the foil. If necessary, run a thin-bladed knife around the edge of the cake to make sure it's not sticking to the sides (which can cause cracks as it cools), then cover with plastic wrap and transfer to the refrigerator to cool for at least 8 hours or overnight.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/new-york-style-cheesecake.html#fv-recipe-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "<strong>For serving:</strong> Remove the sides of the springform pan. Serve the cheesecake right from the base of the pan; or, to transfer it to a serving platter, run a long, thin spatula between the crust and the pan bottom, and then use two large spatulas to carefully transfer the cheesecake to a serving dish. Slice with a sharp knife, wiping the knife clean between slices. Serve with <a href=\"https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/berry-sauce.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">berry sauce</a>, if you like.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/new-york-style-cheesecake.html#fv-recipe-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "<strong>Make Ahead:</strong> The cheesecake can be made and stored in the springform pan in the fridge, tightly covered with plastic wrap, up to two days ahead of time. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/new-york-style-cheesecake.html#fv-recipe-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "<strong>Freezer-Friendly Instructions:</strong> The cheesecake can be frozen for up to 3 months. To freeze, place the cake in the freezer briefly, unwrapped, to firm it up. Then double-wrap it tightly with aluminum foil or plastic freezer wrap, or place it in heavy-duty freezer bag. Thaw in the refrigerator the night before you plan to eat it.  ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/new-york-style-cheesecake.html#fv-recipe-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pro Tip: Springform pans are notorious for leaking. Since a cheesecake bakes in a water bath, the foil prevents the water from seeping in during baking. Please do not attempt to use standard 12-inch (30cm) aluminum foil \u2013 you can\u2019t have any foil seams on the bottom or sides of the pan. No matter how well (or how many times) you wrap the pan, if there are seams exposed to the water, the water will find a way in. Even when wrapped properly, you can occasionally get some condensation inside the foil. If this happens, don\u2019t worry \u2013 the crust is likely just a bit moist around the edges. Simply remove the sides of the springform pan before refrigerating and let it dry out in the refrigerator. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/new-york-style-cheesecake.html#fv-recipe-step-9"}], "recipeIngredient": ["1\u00bd cups graham cracker crumbs, from 12 whole crackers", "5 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted", "2 tablespoons  sugar", "\u215b teaspoon salt", "32 oz (four 8-oz blocks) cream cheese, at room temperature", "2 cups sugar ", "3 tablespoons all-purpose flour", "4 teaspoons vanilla extract", "1 teaspoon packed lemon zest, from 1 lemon", "2 teaspoons fresh lemon juice, from 1 lemon ", "\u00bc teaspoon salt", "6 large eggs ", "\u00bd cup sour cream", " Special equipment: 9- or 10-inch springform pan; 18-inch heavy-duty aluminum foil (see Pro Tip)", " Berry sauce, for serving (optional)"], "recipeYield": "8 to 10", "image": ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2017/12/cheesecake-1200x1393.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2017/12/cheesecake-500x500.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2017/12/cheesecake-500x375.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2017/12/cheesecake-480x270.jpg"], "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": 4.8, "ratingCount": "1056"}, "datePublished": "2022-02-08T10:31:20-05:00", "keywords": "All Seasons, Christmas, Comfort Food, Cream Cheese, Easter, Father's Day, Graham Crackers, Mother's Day, Sour Cream, Springform Pan, Thanksgiving", "recipeCuisine": "American", "recipeCategory": "Recipes"}]

the meatballs: Preheat the oven to 350\u00b0F. Spray the rack generously with nonstick cooking spray.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/italian-wedding-soup.html#fv-recipe-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large bowl, beat the egg with the chives, sage and garlic. Add the remaining meatball ingredients and mash with your hands until evenly combined. Roll the mixture into tablespoon-size balls, about 1 inch in diameter (it will make approximately 50 meatballs), and place on the prepared rack. Bake for 15 to 18 minutes, or until lightly browned and cooked through. Set aside.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/italian-wedding-soup.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Meanwhile, start the soup. In a large soup pot or Dutch oven over medium heat, heat the olive oil. Add the onions, carrots, and celery and cook, stirring frequently, until the vegetables are softened, about 8 minutes. Add the chicken broth, beef broth, water, wine, bay leaf, salt and pepper and bring to a boil. Add the pasta and cook, uncovered, at a gentle boil until the pasta is al dente, 8 to 10 minutes (or according to package directions). Taste the soup and adjust the seasoning, if necessary. Reduce the heat to low and add the spinach and meatballs. Simmer for a few minutes, until the spinach is wilted and the meatballs are warmed through. Ladle into bowls and serve with grated Parmigiano Reggiano. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/italian-wedding-soup.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "<strong>Freezer-Friendly Instructions:</strong>  The soup can be frozen for up to 3 months but wait until you reheat the soup to add the pasta.  Defrost the soup in the refrigerator for 12 hours and then reheat it on the stovetop over medium heat until simmering, add the pasta, and cook until the pasta is tender.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/italian-wedding-soup.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}], "recipeIngredient": ["1  large egg", "3 tablespoons finely chopped fresh chives", "2 teaspoons  finely chopped fresh sage", "2  cloves garlic, minced", "\u00be lb  85 or 90% lean ground beef", "\u00bd lb  sweet or hot Italian sausage, removed from the casings", "\u00bd cup  grated Parmigiano Reggiano", "\u2153 cup  Italian seasoned bread crumbs", "\u00bc teaspoon salt", "2 tablespoons  olive oil", "1  medium yellow onion, diced", "2  large carrots, diced", "2  stalks celery, diced", "6 cups  high-quality chicken broth, such as Swanson (do not use low-sodium)", "2 cups  high-quality beef broth, such as Swanson (do not use low-sodium)", "2 cups  water", "\u00bd cup dry white wine (optional)", "1  bay leaf", "\u00bd teaspoon salt", "\u00bc teaspoon  white pepper (okay to use black pepper)", "1 cup  small pasta such as dittalini", "4 oz  fresh spinach, stems trimmed and roughly chopped (once prepped, you should have about 3 packed cups)", " Parmigiano Reggiano, for serving"], "recipeYield": "8", "image": ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2019/10/20200914_SEGAL_JM0073-1200x1527.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2019/10/20200914_SEGAL_JM0073-500x500.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2019/10/20200914_SEGAL_JM0073-500x375.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2019/10/20200914_SEGAL_JM0073-480x270.jpg"], "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": 4.93, "ratingCount": "269"}, "datePublished": "2019-10-31T06:00:51-04:00", "keywords": "Bread Crumbs, Carrots, Celery, Cheese, Comfort Food, Cookbook 2 Recipe, Fall, Ground Meat, Meatballs, Sausage, Spinach, White Wine, Winter", "recipeCuisine": "Italian", "recipeCategory": "Recipes"}]

Add the peanut butter and mix with a rubber spatula until well combined and the dough is very thick. It will take about 3 minutes of stirring to get to the right consistency (it gets thicker as you continue to stir). (Note: Do not use an electric mixer for this process, as it can cause the peanut butter to separate.)", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/flourless-peanut-butter-cookies.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a #20 (3-tablespoon) cookie scoop, drop the dough into mounds onto the prepared baking sheets. Scoop the dough into balls, sprinkle with salt (and press lightly so it adheres), let set on a baking sheet in the freezer, then place in a sealable bag and press out as much air as possible. Bake as needed directly from the freezer. (Allow 1 to 2 minutes longer in the oven.) To freeze after baking: let the cookies cool completely and store in an airtight container separating layers with parchment paper or aluminum foil. Before serving, remove the cookies from the container and let them come to room temperature.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/flourless-peanut-butter-cookies.html#fv-recipe-step-7"}], "recipeIngredient": ["1\u00be cups (packed) light brown sugar", "2 large eggs", "\u00bd teaspoon vanilla extract", "1\u00be cups creamy peanut butter, preferably Skippy (see note)", " Coarse-grained sea salt, for sprinkling"], "recipeYield": "16 to 18 cookies", "image": ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2020/04/Salted-Peanut-Butter-Cookies-1200x1660.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2020/04/Salted-Peanut-Butter-Cookies-scaled-500x500.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2020/04/Salted-Peanut-Butter-Cookies-scaled-500x375.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2020/04/Salted-Peanut-Butter-Cookies-scaled-480x270.jpg"], "citation": "Adapted from <a style=\"background-color: #ffffff; color: #d85c4c;\" href=\"https://www.oven.ly/\">Ovenly</a> by Agatha Kulaga and Erin Patinkin", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": 4.6, "ratingCount": "63"}, "datePublished": "2020-04-22T13:18:52-04:00", "keywords": "All Seasons, Christmas, Comfort Food, Nut Butter", "recipeCuisine": "American", "recipeCategory": "Recipes"}]

Add the nuts and toss with spice mixture until evenly coated. Transfer the nuts to the prepared baking sheet and arrange in a single layer, making sure the syrupy spice mixture is evenly distributed. Bake for 35 to 45 minutes, stirring once halfway through, until the nuts are caramelized and lightly toasted. (To check for doneness, take a few nuts out of the oven and set them on a cool surface for a few minutes; if done, they will be dry to the touch.) Carefully slide or lift the parchment and nuts off of the hot baking sheet and onto a countertop; let cool completely. Break up the nuts with your hands. This eggs Benedict recipe features perfectly poached eggs, a foolproof blender hollandaise, and crispy bacon on toasted muffins.", "datePublished": "2024-05-09T06:59:13+00:00", "image": ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2024/04/Eggs-Benedict-Featured-Photo.png", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2024/04/Eggs-Benedict-Featured-Photo-500x500.png", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2024/04/Eggs-Benedict-Featured-Photo-500x375.png", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2024/04/Eggs-Benedict-Featured-Photo-480x270.png"], "recipeYield": ["4"], "prepTime": "PT30M", "cookTime": "PT30M", "totalTime": "PT60M", "recipeIngredient": ["4  English muffins", "2 tablespoons unsalted butter", "8  large eggs", "1 tablespoon distilled white vinegar", "1 tablespoon unsalted butter", "8 slices Canadian bacon, (regular bacon, ham steak, or prosciutto (see note))", "3  egg yolks", "\u00bc teaspoon salt", "1\u00bd tablespoons lemon juice, (from 1 lemon)", "Pinch cayenne pepper", "12 tablespoons (1\u00bd sticks) unsalted butter", "Salt and freshly ground black pepper", "Finely chopped fresh chives"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Toast the English Muffins: Split the muffins and toast until golden. Spread with butter, put on a plate, and cover with foil to keep warm.", "name": "Toast the English Muffins: Split the muffins and toast until golden. Spread with butter, put on a plate, and cover with foil to keep warm.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/eggs-benedict.html#wprm-recipe-77622-step-0-0"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Poach the Eggs: Bring 6 cups of water and the vinegar to a gentle simmer in a large saucepan. Optionally, for neater eggs, one at a time, crack each egg into a fine mesh sieve over a bowl or sink, allowing the watery part of the white to drain for about 30 seconds (see note below explaining this step). Regardless of whether or not you strain the eggs, gently transfer each egg into a small cup or ramekin. Then carefully slide the eggs, four at a time, from the cups/ramekins into the simmering water. Cook for 3 to 4 minutes, until the whites are set but yolks are still runny. Avoid stirring the water while the eggs are cooking, as this can break them apart. Use a slotted spoon to transfer them to a paper towel-lined plate to drain. Cover with foil to keep warm, being careful not to puncture the eggs. Repeat with the remaining eggs.", "name": "Poach the Eggs: Bring 6 cups of water and the vinegar to a gentle simmer in a large saucepan. Optionally, for neater eggs, one at a time, crack each egg into a fine mesh sieve over a bowl or sink, allowing the watery part of the white to drain for about 30 seconds (see note below explaining this step). Regardless of whether or not you strain the eggs, gently transfer each egg into a small cup or ramekin. Then carefully slide the eggs, four at a time, from the cups/ramekins into the simmering water. Cook for 3 to 4 minutes, until the whites are set but yolks are still runny. Avoid stirring the water while the eggs are cooking, as this can break them apart. Use a slotted spoon to transfer them to a paper towel-lined plate to drain. Cover with foil to keep warm, being careful not to puncture the eggs. Repeat with the remaining eggs.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/eggs-benedict.html#wprm-recipe-77622-step-0-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Make the Hollandaise Sauce: Blend the egg yolks, salt, lemon juice, and cayenne pepper in a blender until frothy (about 20 seconds). Melt the butter in a small pot over medium heat until bubbling but not browning. Transfer the hot butter to a liquid measuring cup for easy pouring. With the blender running on a low speed, open the center knob and gradually add the hot butter in a thin stream to the egg mixture until the sauce thickens. If the sauce is too thick, blend in 1 to 2 tablespoons of hot water until you reach the desired consistency.", "name": "Make the Hollandaise Sauce: Blend the egg yolks, salt, lemon juice, and cayenne pepper in a blender until frothy (about 20 seconds). With the blender running on a low speed, open the center knob and gradually add the hot butter in a thin stream to the egg mixture until the sauce thickens.
